Reviews.Content: The property is in an ideal location for seeing the best of the best of San Diego; but they don't let you love them because of that...no, they work hard on every single detail of excellence and optimize effectiveness of every single interaction YOU want and on the other hand, leave you alone to enjoy your best possible time! It is my new favorite place to stay and worth the $$! One comment: valet service was impeccable and I used it repeatedly, but they were understaffed at times of event exit causing delay exceeding 45 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan K
Reviews.Content: All I can say is in addition to all of the great amenities that your hotel had to offer, I was really impressed with the bed and how comfortable it was. Each night I laid on that mattress, I was literally out like a light in less than 10 minutes. For me, how well I sleep is the most important thing I consider when booking a hotel. That said, I look forward to making the Westin my hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: Bettie S
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the whole experience very much. The staff were professional, friendly and welcoming. The ambience of the hotel was luxurious, yet comfortable. The room was lovely and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “LES Meeting”
Reviews.Author: h j
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel over others in the area for the good cost-to-value ratio. I was attending a conference at the Marriott 4 blocks away, and found this to be about a 7-minute walk and about 90 dollars a night less. Regarding the hotel and my stay, I was in a double with a view of the water (between other high-rises) and it was very quiet on the 18th floor. Lower floors may have some issues. My infrequent interactions with the Staff found them to be fine. The place is not known for its restaurant, but what I did get was fine but nothing special. The room itself was very nice for the cost.-no issues.

Reviews.Title: “It is fine but there are better Starwood Hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: fvrbtmn
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very friendly and the concierge was very helpful. However, the valet parking was expensive and it turned out that the staff parked our rental car across the street in the city public parking lot! Room was fine with nice bay view. If you are here for business meeting, this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location....”
Reviews.Author: stonewithnomoss
Reviews.Content: Stayed here prior to a cruise. It is really within walking distance of the cruise pier if you don't bring much luggage (doubtful for a week's cruise). The gaslight district, the San Diego Trolley, the railway station, the waterfront .... they are all right nearby. It is clean and well appointed. The price was right since we got a discounted room in conjunction with the cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Room renovation on a Saturday”
Reviews.Author: Henry V
Reviews.Content: My stay was overall very good. Excellent front desk personnel. Only problem was that on Saturday night when we returned someone decided to paint something in a room on our floor. The AC grills were left outside on the hallway on a trolley and the room door propped open with the result that the whole floor smelled of paint and chemicals. When we open our room the smell was overwhelming. I called the manager and Lex, a supervisor called back., He said he would look into to it but a half hour later the trolley was still there and the door still propped open with the same smell everywhere (other guests came out of their room and also complained). This is not something that should be done on a weekend nor in the evening hours. It's disappointing that Lex did not do something about it nor did he follow up with us. Compared to the rest of our stay and service he seriously lacked.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty reliable Westin”
Reviews.Author: KimberlyQ
Reviews.Content: I prefer to stay in Westins when I'm on biz travel. I'm a Starwood loyalist, and W's are just too noisy for me. This Westin was in a handy location (close to the Gas Lamp, but not *in* the Gas Lamp) was consistent in most ways with the others, except I found the front desk and maid service to be lackluster. The girl I checked in with was cold and blasé, and when I got back to my room at the end of the day, the bathroom was not neatened at all; the maid only put a couple of products on the counter. A container of my face cleaser was even turned sideways and was leaking onto the floor.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing stay; great location; complimentary shuttle”
Reviews.Author: SierraRose2005
Reviews.Content: We love visiting San Diego and discovering what's new and re-discovering what we've seen before. This Westin hotel is perfect in so many ways, starting with the complimentary airport shuttle (Eric, our driver, gave us many suggestions on what to see/do). Front desk allowed us to check-in early and check-out late. Purchased a 3-day trolley/bus pass (a real bargain at $12/per person) and rode all over. Trolley station is just 2 blocks away at Sfe Depot. Go 2 blocks more and you're at Broadway Pier. Lots of restaurants nearby. Rooms were clean, comfortable (love the Heavenly Bed), quiet with a fridge, bottled water and coffee. Staff for the most part was attentive. Kudos to Melissa in the lounge who knows the meaning of service. Only negative is the $12.95/day Internet charge. Even so, we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & completely servicable”
Reviews.Author: norodo
Reviews.Content: This Westin is located near the Sante Fe station, the Harbor tours, Seaport Village etc. It's also a 20 minute walk/5 min trolley ride to the Gaslamp District...you can travel along the avenue parallel to the harbor or meander through the civic area into gaslight, if the local, colorful population doesn't dissuade you. (We did it daily.) The hotel is 1/2 hotel, 1/2 corporate offices, and the lobby feels disjointed and uninviting. The bar has no sense of place, but once you're in the room, it's comfortable, with great sheets, double-headed shower, OK towels (not too soft) and plastic disposable cups instead of glass. Rooms also offer Starbucks coffee and an empty mini-fridge. The free shuttle to/from the airport was a great bonus, making it a strong value overall.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very very comfortable beds!”
Reviews.Author: JennaMarie360
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. Our room had a great view of the bay and the city. It was a short walk to the gaslamp quarter but far enough away that it was quiet at night. It was also only a 10min walk in the other direction to the bay. The staff was very helpful and over-the-top welcoming. They were able to answer all of our questions and reccomend attractions and restaurants. The king-sized bed in our room was amazing, we slept very well each night of our stay. We were very pleased to find starbucks coffee and tea in our room as well! The roof top pool certainly looked better in the pictures on their website. The pool and hot tub are in need of repair and cleaning. However, the other aspects of this hotel out shine their dingy pool so we will still be reccomending it to others!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: galegood
Reviews.Content: After having problems with the reservation (our fault) and almost leaving to find another hotel, the manager was very helpful in trying to talk us into keeping our reservation. The staff was excellent, rooms were very clean and large. The bartenders in the lounge during happy hour were excellent. (Thank you for the nail polish remover). :)Great location if you like to walk. Breakfast was delicious. We we able to pick off the buffett for my 2 year old grandson at no cost. Look forward to staying there next year for our annual family visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Canuck60
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin SD on September 24th for one night.....Room 1311 ...corner room with a view of the bay. Reception desk very friendly....Kaylia was very pleasant and since we were coming back for one week Oct 1-8 she said that she would try to give us a room that ended in 11. Our next stay for 7 days was in room 411 which faced into the Atrium.....Very Clean....Complimentary water (SPG member). Had a couple of minor problems that were very quickly resolved by the Maintenance man Ron with complimentary tickets for drinks....Thank you! Our housekeeper Maritza M. was excellent. We would see her in the morning and tell her that we were going out and our room was always made up when we arrived back... Thank you for your attentiveness...She would always ask if we needed anything else. The pool and jaccuzi were very clean and hardly any one in them... Enjoyed sitting out on the pool patio.... Great area to get some sun and a lot of chaise and umbrellas if you wanted shade. The view from the deck was also great . The pool and jaccuzi area could use a new coat of paint but again were extremely clean and well set up. The woman who set out the cushions and the towels was meticulous. Could not help but notice that she refolded the towels making sure that the corners matched. I would recommend this hotel for its cleanliness and location.....walking distance to trolleys , shopping, eating...... Conceirege was very helpful...A Fantastic stay... even if the plumbing gurgled in the morning....Thank you Westin!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel and staff, food not so much”
Reviews.Author: Macahwe
Reviews.Content: We were here for a week for a confernce and really enjoyed our stay! Being walkers it was an idea location, close to everything, Concierge was very helpful providing routes and tmes. Fourtunately she also gave us great tips to eat in all price ranges. Would we stay here again..ABSOLUTELY. Would we eat here again.......... NO. We are returning in Nov for another week for a family event but will eat elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal place to stay”
Reviews.Author: shannonff
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 12 days its a great location for all the attraction in San Diego and surrounding area. the hotel is close to the harbour and the Gaslamp Quarter all within walking distance also Horton plaza shopping. If you want to go further a field the trolley and bus are close by with a great day pass available that can be used on both which will get you to Seaworld, San Diego zoo and all the museums in balboa park. The room was large with coffee making facility and fridge the bed was comfortable and i love the bath robe. the staff were very good they helped me arrange travel to Disney and Universal studios in L.A. A lot of people complain about having to pay for wi-fi but it was free in the reception area which was fine for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: BigmanBrighton
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights prior to my cruise. The location is ideal for the harbour and the trolley services. A much better and newer hotel than it's namesake in The Gaslamp Quarter that was only a 10 minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: MaxnKel
Reviews.Content: I was redirected to this hotel due to an overbooking at another San Diego hotel. I wasn't happy about it, but the terrific staff changed my mind. The front desk employees were so gracious, and provided us with excellent customer service. The room had a spectacular view, and was very nice. I had nothing to complain about regarding my room or the service we received, the Westin turned a negative into a positive for us.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly pillows, tiny room, overpriced”
Reviews.Author: jeremyfd
Reviews.Content: Briefly: room small, expensive, mediocre fittings but with great view. Pillows smelled old and greasy so we asked them to be changed, same turned up so no better. Hotel is in an office block, strangely restaurant was closed at lunch, there's a bar but no cafeteria so no place to eat out of hours. The killer is the price, way too high for what you get, and then you pay parking on top. This is no Westin, it's just a hotel that charges too much without the corresponding service.

Reviews.Title: “I love Westin!”
Reviews.Author: EB0109
Reviews.Content: I'm so glad I decided to splash out a little and book this hotel. As I was travelling alone I wanted to make sure I was somewhere safe and fairly central. The location is excellent, in walking distance of the Gaslamp quarter, Seaport Village, public transport stops and the ferries. My room was very clean and was well maintained during my stay. Toiletries and complimentary water bottles were replaced daily. Hotel staff especially the concierges were extremely helpful in planning my days and even came up with discount coupons for some attractions. I saved $20 on Seaworld! The rooftop pool was an added bonus after long days on my feet. I loved the elevators on the outside of the building - brilliant views on the way up to my room! I also felt safe walking alone at night back to the hotel. Overall I couldn't have had a better stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: Lesley T
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Westin for 5 nights for a combined business and recreation trip. The only thing that kept me from rating this hotel with 5 stars was a bad night with a loud party next door--even though that has to do with the guests and not the hotel, it marred my experience of an otherwise perfect stay--more about that later. About the hotel: From the first, all the Westin staff were fantastic! Be aware that there are two Westins only a few blocks apart. Not reading the address carefully, I arrived at the other Westin -- the staff there offered to cab me to the correct Westin, but being a nice day, I wanted to walk. A staff member walked with me, suitcase and all! At the correct Westin, the staff throughout the hotel were fantastic with every interaction every day for all 5 days and nights. My stay was marred only by a large noisy party next door to me on Saturday night. The hotel staff did their best to quiet the group, and eventually, just before the last chance before eviction, the group quieted down. There's no way to know that a group in a hotel will be inconsiderate...but it is nice to feel supported by the hotel staff in attempting to control the situation. The hotel location was great -- just about 4 blocks to the water and in direct line with the ferry to Coronado. Just 2 blocks to the trolley station. For those who enjoy walking, a brisk 25 minute walk brought me to the convention center. At the hotel, the bar has a great happy hour (4-7 pm) every night with good appetizers. The business center is open 24/7 -- a real plus! Outdoor lap pool and nice fitness center. Very clean and neat all around. Complimentary fruit-enhanced water in the lobby all day long.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tea4mepls
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt, the Westin San Diego employs the nicest people! The staff here is wonderful - friendly, helpful, always with a smile for you! The courtesy van to and from the airport was an added bonus that this property offers. Within walking distance to the Amtrack/Coaster train, the marina area to see the Midway, Horton Plaza for shopping, and lots of restaurants, this downtown location is great! Ask for a higher floor to enjoy the city views at night from your window. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ntaormina
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to San Diego for a weekend away from the kids to celebrate my birthday. We checked in Friday and soon after made our way down to the marina on our bikes and went for a beautiful bike ride. Upon our return we were greeted by a mini desert tray with a Happy Birthday note from the hotel. We had brought our bikes down and the hotel stored them everyday without issue. We walked to The Gaslamp district both nights for dinner. It's a short 10 minute walk. The work out room is clean and big with plenty of equipment. The pool is a little on the small side but it's outdoors on the 3rd floor and going to sit in the jacuzzi Saturday night before going out hit the spot. The overall vibe of the hotel seems more suited for the business traveller rather than an intimate romantic setting or family environment. The Happy Hour in the hotel bar was great. The rooms were spacious. We had a corner room and overall it was very comfortable. The sitting chair could use a cleaning but the beds are super comfy. Overall, the hotel is in a great location and it's a Westin so service is their priority. We had a great weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Dated property,excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: rfolih
Reviews.Content: Very dated business hotel in a quiet area. Rooms are boring and bathrooms very small. Beds very comfortable. No minibar...why? Isn't that a huge money maker? But I have to say they staff is wonderful from the front desk to the bartenders. My friend burned his fingers somewhere else and the barstaff at the Westin were wonderful. Chris Arismendez and Melissa Metroka were wonderful! They were concerned and brought him burn spray and gel...so thoughtful and beyond the call of duty. You guys deserve a raise for being so thoughtful. I don't know if I'll stay there again but I'll talk about the excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “OVER THE TOP customer service!”
Reviews.Author: littleroundtop
Reviews.Content: The staff were incomparable! Jackie took care of our every need and felt like family by the end of our stay! We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Tracy75_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin for 10 days and we were very impressed. The customer service is exceptional, with every member of staff going out of their way to make you feel welcome. Special thanks must go to Melissa who ran the bar area, she made sure we were never without drinks or snacks and even attempted to explain the rules of baseball to 2 brits! The hotel is well located with the USS Midway, seaport village and gaslamp district 5 - 10 minutes walk. The rooms were well laid out, if a little dated, however the bed and TV system made up for the little niggles. The hotel also provides a free courtesy bus to and from the airport, which is extremley helpful after a long flight. We would definetly stay at the Westin next time we are in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Average business hotel, nice staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: MAtraveler01
Reviews.Content: I stayed while attending a conference at the convention center, as it was $75/night cheaper than the hilton. I've stayed in a few westin's before, and was a bit let down. First, the positives: - wonderful ocean view from the 17th floor - nice sized room, comfy beds, mini-fridge, new TV - huge bathroom and AWESOME shower!! true for all westin's, but really, it's just so great - friendly staff - location! 20 minutes walk to convention center, 10 to gaslamp, 10 to little italy, 2 to trolley, 5 to water. There were some disappointments. I suppose I shouldn't complain, I just have come to expect more from the Westin: - the "complimentary" internet access in the lobby is really only for 30 minutes at a time, and then they kick you off. I found this out the hard way while trying to send an important e-mail!! I don't care if they only give you 30 minutes, but they should tell you that!! - the bathroom door wouldn't stay open unless propped with something, and since there was no fan in the bathroom we had to use a shoe to prop open the door after showers. just not something you expect to have to do at a nice hotel - the ironing board was covered in some specs of dirt or something. got my nice white shirt dirty before I noticed - the gym. It was fine, a basic hotel gym with a few new-ish machines and free weights, but when you advertise a "Reebok fitness center" or whatever I expect something nicer than what you get at the Marriott or Hilton garden inn. It wasn't. All in all it was a great stay, it was comfortable, and it was much cheaper than some of the other options. I guess I just got my hopes up too high. I would stay here again though if it continues to be cheaper than other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: downunder1975
Reviews.Content: Westin is my preferred hotel chain and this one does not disappoint. This was my first stay in this particular property as I usually stay at the nearby Westin Gaslamp (Horton Plaza). When I couldn't get a room at the Gaslamp property, I reluctantly took the room here. I should not have been worried. Of the two hotels, the staff at this hotel was the better of the two. From the valet to the bell person and everyone in between, the staff was exceptional. We were down in San Diego for my son's first birthday (zoo trip!) so we had a lot of "gear" for him. The bell staff was extremely helpful in getting everything out of the car, bringing it up to the room and helping us get things like ice to keep his food cold. The valet staff also was very gracious in retreiving toys from the car that this dumb dad forgot. We didn't take advantage of a lot of other services since it was a short trip, but I will definitely consider going there again. If you go, try to get a water view. We were on a Preferred Guest floor and the views of water were amazing, especially at sunset and daybreak. There are only two slight drawbacks which prevent me from giving it 5 stars. First, the room, while an acceptable Westin room, was not as updated as other properties I have been in. To whit, there was no minifridge. There was a space in furniture for one. Second, it is slightly on the outskirts of downtown. Granted it is not a far walk (or a cheap taxi) to the Gaslamp district, it is farther out than the other Westin at Horton Plaza. If you don't walk to walk far, Karl Strauss brewpub is a short stroll up the street from this hotel. A great option for either a business traveler or a family guy. It is within walking distance of Santa Fe station if you arrive in San Diego via Amtrak.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Dallas C
Reviews.Content: Nathan Nichols served us lunch day 1 and he was great! The beds are amazing! The service from check-in to room service to Valet was all A++ We had a 3 day event and I was in that hotel for 4 full days and felt well taken care of! I'd stay there again in a heartbeat! Thank you Dallas Cyr

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: appletonWI
Reviews.Content: Just your average business hotel. More modern than the Westin Gaslamp, which is only 4 blocks away. Internet in the room costs $, parking costs $, but the bar offers free WiFi and, coincidentally, has a pretty good happy hour. Walls in the room are thin.... could clearly hear the guy in the next room talking on his cell phone and he was not yelling or anything.

Reviews.Title: “What an awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: michellemcdan
Reviews.Content: The staff of this hotel went out of their way to welcome us and make us feel comfortable. We were there to celebrate our son's graduate from boot camp and the know how to make you feel comfortable and most of all respected. We would especially like to thank our bartender Mark D...he made us feel like he knew us forever. Always fun and friendly. I recommend that you stay at this hotel so that you can be treated like royalty.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING STAY!!”
Reviews.Author: pamela m
Reviews.Content: We had never been to San Diego. Took a bucket list trip over Labor day weekend and stayed at the westin-emerald plaza- This hotel is in a central enough area to everything, good size rooms, super clean, great restaurant, good gym, big pool but overall THE STAFF AT THIS PROPERTY IS AMAZING. We knew our trip was off to the right start with the complimentary pick up at the airport and our driver. Mike Stanik proved to be an awesome guide 5 minutes in.. thee nicest guy and so great. Front Desk-we had the pleasure of checking in with Luke Profancik, Stephen Kelly-they welcomed us like we were home. Concierge-just like, Luke and Stephen, we threw alot at ideas out to Molly moran and she was able to keep up and hook us up with everything we needed. We saw all of san diego and then some... and it was b/c of this staff's attention to detail. i.e-knew we had a late flight, and without even telling us-gave us a complimentary late checkout. knew we wanted to see more of cali on our trip-hooked us up with a great deal for rental car Our trip had the red carpet laid out from the minute we landed until the time we got back on the plane to leave. WE had a great trip and would definitely recommend this Westin to anyone..and tell them to say hi to Mike, Stephen, Luke and Molly for us!

Reviews.Title: “At home”
Reviews.Author: ELAN2009
Reviews.Content: We were at the Westin San Diego for 10 days, that's a long time with a 15 month old. My husband was there for work and we were just there to be with him and enjoy the city. The staff at this hotel was amazing: from the concierge, to the front desk, to the restaurant staff, they were all kind, helpful and made us feel at home. We would HIGHLY recommend the hotel, not only for the hotel property, but mostly for it's staff. We also unfortunately were staying here when the blackout occurred and we were very impressed with the actions and staff during this very challenging time.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous all around.”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer T
Reviews.Content: First of all, I'm from San Diego and have known about this hotel. I've never stayed until the weekend of 9/10/11, my wedding day. My cousin (my maid of honor), booked us a room so all the bridesmaids can get ready for the wedding. Luke, the hotel manager, was very accomodating to all our needs. Not only did he see us when we first walked in (he noticed the white dress hanging on the bellman's baggage cart), he took the time to come up to us, shake our hands and agreed to help us prepare for the big day. We checked in, and the front desk lady was great (I believe her name is Geena?). She was patient enough to ask how we were doing and even granted my nephew his own keycard (he asked me earlier if he can have his own and I told him no because he might lose it). She was sweet enough to do that for him and it made his day. When we went into our room, we noticed it wouldn't be spacious enough to accomodate my hair, makeup, photographers and bridesmaids for preparation. So we went downstairs, asked Geena if we can get a bigger room. She offered to show us 2 rooms and we decided to take the first room she showed us. The bellman's were very prompt and friendly. They talked to us and made sure we were doing well and if there were any thing else we needed. Luke offered us a meeting room to prepare and it was perfect. His staff came in to check if we were doing ok as the time passed. They even brought in an extra mirror for us to use. This is by far the most acoomodating, professional, sincere, thoughtful, and friendly hotel I've stayed at and would recommend this to anyone. Thank you to Luke and his Westin Staff for a job well done! Applause! Jenn and Archie Geronimo Reservation name under: Myra Tabaldo

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!--Comfy, Posh, Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: JenLF26
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during Comic Con one year and my overall experience was awesome. The room was big. The bed was really soft and comfy. The bathroom was nice and neat--had everything I needed. Although the shower handle broke upon first use, the concierge was quick to get it fixed. Loved the design of the whole place--from lobby, to bedroom, and overall building. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. Had a great stay & would love to go back. I also thought it was neat how they had fancy water dispensers filled with fresh fruit in the lobby--was really refreshing after a long day at comic con!

Reviews.Title: “Top notch hotel with fantastic customer service”
Reviews.Author: Sunandfun123020
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Westin for several days for a business trip. As luck would have it, I happened to be there during the black-out that hit on September 8. I was extremely impressed by how well prepared the Westin was and how accomodating its staff was. They immediately passed out flashlights and put out cold cut platters, chips and water (for free) for all of its guests. This was wonderful considering that every single restaurant and food vendor in the city was shut down! All of the staff stayed put and did everything possible to make our stay wonderful even without electricity. I highly recommend this hotel and will be back for future stays to the San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, friendly staff, easy walk to Gaslamp Quarter”
Reviews.Author: dreatica
Reviews.Content: I always enjoy my stays at Westin hotels and this was no different. Front desk, concierge and housekeeping staff were very nice and helpful. The housekeeper, Maria Guerrero, went out of her way to keep us stocked and always with a friendly smile.

Reviews.Title: “No Power... no worries”
Reviews.Author: MallariRacing
Reviews.Content: Checked in at the Westin the day of the great power outage... After fighting traffic for 1.5 hours to go 8 miles. Got there and no power but plenty of friendly staff to help you along. Flashlights, glow sticks, snacks, and we were in for the night. Wake up in the morning to order room service and Nate 'the great' Nichols makes sure the food comes with smiles and entertainment for our young ones. It's this great service that will have me back at this hotel when I'm in SD for business. Nice work Westin you've most definitely earned my business!

Reviews.Title: “after years and years ... we are leaving Mariott”
Reviews.Author: Carl C
Reviews.Content: this has been out third experience with Westin .... in various cities .... we have made a decision ... we are leaving Marriott ... and moving over to Westin trust me ... I have paid Marriott a big bunch of pennies over the past 9 months ... Costa Rica, Chicago, Berlin, Hamburh, NY ..... been with Marriott since 1980 ... we gone ....they lost us... so Westin San Diego ...... great property ... pool forget it - ya don't need it bar .... one person on staff who is totally incompetent ... I think he is the brother in law who needs a job ...but the woman will fix everything ..... internet ..... give me a break ... the charges in the office building are outragous .... so .... why should you stay there ......... nice people ..... THE MOST IMPORTANT PERSON IS THE PERSON WHO CLEANS THE ROOM .... AND DO THEY EVER KNOW WHAT THEY ARE DOING .....

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Carol M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin for the first time. Our room was lovely, overlooking the harbor. Room service was fast and the food was delicious. We received wonderful service, particularly from Nathan Nichols who went out of his way to make our stay more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “sensational facilities and service - first class!!”
Reviews.Author: omg75
Reviews.Content: truly adored the westin. service was exemplary, all staff are welcoming and genuinely friendly and address you by your name over the phone, really appreciated the impeccable service. the rooms are well appointed and spacious, olde world glamour. loved the gorgeous pool and even used the (basic) gym. the westin is a perfect ten and was definitely a highlight of our stay in san diego. thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room an great service”
Reviews.Author: Rhys R
Reviews.Content: The hotel provided great customer service and nice amenities during my stay. This was the first hotel that I stayed in where the fitness room actually had great equipment and free weights to work out with. There was more than one pool and near the fitness room they had hot tubs. The King size room was a bit smaller than I thought but the bathroom was a very nice size so I guess that was the trade off, Breakfast was great as well, and the servers were good about coming around to my table to check on me and keep my glass full. Valet parking attendants were great also and actually had some personality to them unlike some places where they have kind of dry humor. The best part of my stay was the front desk attendant Mellisa. Of all hotels that I have visited, Mellisa has the most radiant personality ever. She was extremely helpful in giving me assistance anytime that I approached and never once did she treat me as though I was bothersome though I knew that I took up a bit of her time with questions. Kayti and Jackie were great as well, they were both helpful and patient.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but....”
Reviews.Author: SDURR3TT
Reviews.Content: My daughter's hair turned green from the chlorine in the pool! The hotel itself was nice but being I'm still trying to get the green out, I probably wouldn't stay there again because I wouldn't want to swim in the pool, which is my daughter's favorite part.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, except for one thing.”
Reviews.Author: Joescb
Reviews.Content: Came out for a fitness seminar my husband was attending and for a mini vacation. My 2 yr old had a blast at the pool and overall it was a pleasant experience. The only problem was when I made reservations, I asked if we could reserve a refrigerator, and the rep stated she had it noted. Upon check in, the counter person called to see if one was available (it wasn't). We were put on a waiting list, but during our stay, we were never contacted about one being available. This was to keep our daughter's milk cold.

Reviews.Title: “So so”
Reviews.Author: robert_g_w_brown
Reviews.Content: The internet signal in my room (1816) was so weak as to be virtually unusable - and the connection speed ridiculously slow. Not good if you are doing business. I had to sit on the floor by the elevators (no chairs in the corridors) to get wi-fi signal - as there's none in the lobby for guests - that I could find. The dinner menu is seriously boring....the breakfasts OK, except for the day that coachloads of people filled the restaurant and lined-up outside in the lobby. The Hotel can't cope with a coachload of people all at once. The Welcome at check-in was cool. The room itself was comfortable, if rather cramped around the bed. It's confusing that there is another Westin in the Horton Center very close by. One of them needs a different name.

Reviews.Title: “Classy place good location”
Reviews.Author: BaronFoer
Reviews.Content: Nicely appointed hotel. A bit high on price especially since parking is brutal considering the price for the room. Great lap pool, jacuzzi and workout area. bathroom and room are upscale and comfortable. The ironing board is cheap though, but usable. Close to everything downtown and the water. Many fun sites on the water including the aircraft carrier museum and several sailing ships. Shopping area just up the street. Only 5 blocks away is "Little Italy" with great restaraunts. Look for the one with the deli in front.

Reviews.Title: “KAYTI IS AMAZING AND EXTRAORDINARY!”
Reviews.Author: DAVID n
Reviews.Content: Susan Fournier and I attended a conference, and stayed three nights. Kayti went out of her way to provide us with everthing we needed and wanted during our stay. She is an asset to Westin, and we commend her abundantly. Here's to Kayti, Dr. David Noel and Susan Fournier

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and we'd definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: AJandJG
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin for one night, mid-week. We had an excellent stay. Our room was very nice, comfortable, and quiet. It was in easy walking distance to the water and the Midway museum. We also walked over to Seaport Village. The concierge was very helpful and gave us discount tickets to the Midway. We loved the flavored water available in the lobby. We would also recommend the Grand Central Cafe for breakfast, which is about 1 block from the hotel. Parking is expensive, but it's expensive everywhere. We didn't need our car until checkout and could've saved a few dollars by parking in the garage across the street, but we didn't realize that in time. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way”
Reviews.Author: MelI92
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the other Westin in San Diego (Horton Plaza), we were prepared for a pleasant, but not excellent stay. We were very pleasantly surprised. This primairly business hotel was superb in almost every way. Our room was clean and well appointed. The entire staff was helpful, remembering our name when they valet parked the car and responding quickly to every need. Service at the restaurant and bar was timely and thoughtful. Without asking, our snack mix was refilled constantly while we enjoyed our drinks. The bonus was that the room cost was less than the other Westin. The location is ideal, with short walks to the piers and a slightly longer walk to Seaport Village. Even when the hotel was crowded, everything worked smoothly. A tip of the hat to Lex, who helped us get into our room earlier than planned. All-in-all, a very good stay at a very good hotel. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful overall service”
Reviews.Author: Cathy H
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at a Westin and I mostly chose it due to the location which was in the heart of downtown San Diego. One of the most important benefits for me was that they offered a complimentary pick-up at the airport. I was worried about this, though, wondering just how long the wait would be since it was free. From the time I called the hotel to tell them I arrived at the airport to the time they picked me us was ten minutes(or less) - great first impression! The driver's name was Nathan and he was super friendly and pleasant and had a cooler filled with water bottles, which he offered to myself and the two other passengers in the vehicle. The drive to the hotel was very short, but Nathan maintained conversation, sharing some San Diego "tidbits" along the way. I arrived at the hotel pretty late in the evening and having traveled from the east coast I was tired and ready to relax, but hungry. The front desk shared there was a 7-11 just around the corner, a short walk, which was perfect to grab a quick snack. I love that Horton Plaza was only about a 10-minute walk from the hotel and the marina was about the same distance in the opposite direction. I have two minor complaints. First, the trash can hadn't been emptied in the room, which I found to be a little uncool and not of the quality I'd expect from the Westin, but the rest of the room was wonderful and the bed was super comfortable. However, I was awakened really early in the morning by what could be described as a loud booming sound, like it was literally in the hotel. It kept happening and I couldn't get back to sleep. At 7a.m. I decided to call the front desk and express my displeasure in the fact I'd been awakened so early by a sound that I wouldn't expect in a hotel. The agent expressed he had no idea what it could be and that no other guest had complained, but that he would let his manager know and see what they could do for me. Nobody called back. At 10 a.m. after a run and a small bite to eat I headed down to walk over to Horton Plaza and decided to mention at the desk that I had called 3 hours prior with a concern, but heard back from nobody. What was a smaller complaint was now much larger because I felt ignored. Immediately Nathan(remember from the night prior?) stepped in wanting to help and see what he could offer to fix this for me. Needless to say, he turned things around for me. He listened, I felt heard, and he made things right for me and I left as a happy guest. Even if a stay isn't perfect, that's okay, it's how the employees handle your concerns that can make all the difference. Thank you Nathan!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for a Westin.”
Reviews.Author: Lee01
Reviews.Content: I liked the location, easy walking distance to the gas lamp district without being in the heart of all the noise and action. Two blocks from the court house. I thought the room was old and dated, and not very clean. When I talked with central reservations, and asked what the difference was between the traditonal and deluxe room, I was told the deluxe room had a mini bar. We checked checked in late after a long drive down from SF. I asked the woman at the front desk if the hotel had a 24 cafe, she told me no but let me know the 7-11 around the corner was open 24 hours. I did enjoy the pool and gym.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Jenni S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a mini vacation while touring San Diego. The service was great all around from the airport pick-up, check in/out, luggage assistance. The rooms were clean, nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: bzzltyr
Reviews.Content: The good: Room was spacious, had a great view and was very clean. Service was top notch, everyone was very friendly, gave out great tips for places in the city. My family all loved the fruit flavored waters in the lobby, it was very refreshing and coming in to the hotel after a long day was instantly relaxing, it's a beautiful building. Very happy with the rate I got on Hotwire (and I dont think we were punished by that rate with our room choice, we had a great view). More than anything though I can't say enough about what a perfect location this is for exploring the city on foot. You go a couple blocks west and you are at the bay and it's boardwalk, can see all kinds of interesting ships and aircraft carriers. About 10 minutes walk north of the hotel is Little Italy which had some wonderful authentic restaurants and gelato and is worth checking out. Two minutes walk from the hotel is Karl Strauss which if you've had a long day and dont feel like walking is very close and a cool very good place to eat (their mac and cheese choices are great). and about 10 minutes west of the hotel is the gaslamp district with great restaurants and good architecture. Took us about 15 minutes drive to get to coronado beach and less than 10 to the zoo. Seaworld was about 20 minutes away, farthest drive we had while there. Never having been to the city this is a perfect place to stay and walk around. The Bad: 1)Valet Parking. $32 a day, they will justify this by telling you this is the standard for the city. Then they will drive your car across the street to the clearly marked $15 a night lot (really, stay and watch them do it, it's very insulting watching you pay an extra $17 a night for someone to walk a hundred feet). It will actually take you less time to park your car in that lot than to have them walk over to get it and drive it over to you. I saw quite a few Valet options walking around the city and they ranged from $10-$15 so I'm not sure when the last time they checked out what the standard was. 2)Prices in general for anything else. The buffet is VERY overpriced for how simple it is (good but something like $25 a person for bacon, eggs, hashbrowns. maybe 8 different things to choose from).. Still charging for wifi that most hotels include these days (even those charging much less to stay). The parking I've already mentioned. I know there is a slight premium to staying at a hotel but it was definitely overboard and there are plenty of choices to avoid it once you know the city even less than 5 minutes walk from hotel. 3)Dream bed. We had our kids so we had two doubles. I don't know if you dont get the dream bed with two doubles I'd be curious to find out if thats the case. But if that really was the dream bed then it's very disappointing. The sheets were nice but the bed was pretty hard to sleep on. The dream shower however I loved. That said the positives very much outweighed the bad, we had a great time here and I would recommend it to anyone as long as they understood to never eat here or pay to park here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel wrong room”
Reviews.Author: DaSpazz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice however on each floor are two tiny rooms tucked behind the service elevators. They are barely 200 square feet and just fit a bed and desk. I have stayed here before and the rest of the rooms are big and nice. I booked through hotwire for a low rate so I think that is why we got this room. I would stay here again however I will not stay in a room ending in 11 or 12. Tip parking is 32 dollars however right across the street is covered parking for $15 and this is where they park your car for $32.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with walking distance to Gaslamp Quarter”
Reviews.Author: RajSip
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a very comfortable stay with family at The Westin in San Diago. The service was excellent, the rooms very comfortable and the gym and pool were outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointing for a Westin”
Reviews.Author: AndreaL426
Reviews.Content: My husband went down to San Diego for a convention. We decided that myself and son would come down a few days later to enjoy the weekend in San Diego and take our son to Legoland. I am a Travel Agent. I do my research on hotels very thoroughly. I have been in this business long enough to know that there are some times where bad things happen, and one review is just one review. I am hoping that our experience was just a fluke and won't happen again. But we were HUGHLY disappointed in the Westin San Diego. Enough to know that I will not be staying there again and I will not put any clients there! I did like the location. Very close to a lot of things. If you are looking for a nice family place, I'm not sure this is the place for you. The pool is small. Only goes to 4 feet. Our son could spend all day in the pool if we were to let him, so the 4 ft pool was a little disappointing for him, but is something we can deal with. Not a big deal for me. Rooms were nice. Our room had a pocket door that separated the tub & toilet from the sink and the rest of the room. I noticed that the pocket door was only half painted. Like when someone went to repaint the room, they didn't bother to take the pocket door off the hooks and paint it fully. They didn't even bother to shut the door all the way. So there was a good 2 inch spot on the right side of the door that was a completely different color. A few times, our room wasn't made up until we were on our way to dinner. The thing that topped it off was on our last night, Saturday night. We had gone to Legoland, spent the day there. Came back and had a bad dinner at one of the local restaurants. We were tired, cranky and wanted to just get a good nights sleep. Came back to our room at 10:30pm. We noticed that the room right next to us had the door cracked and there was a party going on. At 10:45pm, my husband called down to security and told them about the noise. Security came up and told them to quiet down. We fell asleep until about 3:30am, when something woke all of us up. It was the banging of doors as people went in and out of the door and into the East Stair Way. They were SMOKING in the stairway! In a NON-Smoking Hotel!!! Again, we called to Security. In the morning, we went down to talk to them about our bill. They charged us $20's more than the rate we thought we were getting because my husband added me onto the room. Ok ... even though I wasn't there the whole time, we decided to pick our battles and just pay the extra $100's that we weren't expecting the room total to be that much. My husband also brought up about the 2 times that we called security to have them come take care of the party next door. Not necessarily to get compensation but just to bring it to their attention that we did not pay $200's a night to stay at a nice hotel to hear a party and smell smoke all night long! That is when the little customer service that we already had been dealing with went out the window. They started to say that there was NO record of any noise complaints all night. We were just dealing with one of the girls at the front desk. She kept going back to ask her manager what to do. The manager approved her to take $40's off our bill (very nice and we would have been happy with just that) and as she did that, she completely IGNORED my husband as he asked her other questions. Wouldn't even look at him … dead stare at the screen. My husband then asked for the manager on duty. The manager came out and proceeded to argue with us that because there was no reports on the security log that we were lying. My husband even told the manager the conversation the security guard had with the people in the room next door, and that he should be able to track the phone calls that came from our room to security. The manager said there was no way he would be able to do that. But then went to get his business card and was gone quite a long time. When the manager came back out, he did offer to comp our room for the one night and then even offered us breakfast at the restaurant in the lobby. That was nice and is very appreciated but I thought very sad that we had to go thru that whole ordeal. We were not staying at a Motel 6 but we have had better service at one. We paid $200's per night for our room and we expect to get a $200 a night service. I don't believe that we got it at all. Also, the manager did state that the hotel noise policy is that the 1st time security is called for noise, that is the final warning. If it happens again, everyone is supposed to be kicked out. And they are in complete violation for smoking in the stairway. (We do have photos of the cigarette butts in the stair way also.) Obviously that didn't happen. Someone screwed up. Someone didn't do his or her job.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but they nickel and dime you”
Reviews.Author: Silverbullet1972
Reviews.Content: The room itself was nice. We were told we were getting a king, but it was more like a queen. They supplied bottled water for $5, internet for $15 and other things for various costs. Parking was $24 a night. Thank goodness there was a little cafe downstairs where you could get refreshments without breaking the bank. I was also glad to have internet from my phone.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Hotel and staff, we'll definitely be back - Thanks Kayti”
Reviews.Author: themick073
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this particular Westin hotel before and numerous other 4 star hotels in downtown San Diego including your Hortons Plaza Hotel but this stay was wonderful. My family loves this hotel due to its location, the beds and the employees. The employees at this hotel are always friendly and ready to help but this stay was particularly special due to one employee, Kayti (front desk). She was so friendly and welcoming, my two daughters loved her, she even sent cookies to our room for my daughter’s birthday and let them pick stuffed animals from your prize wagon, customer service is not lost on this employee. We stayed for 5 days and when we went to check out my daughter was crying because she didnt want to leave and Kayti came over and gave both my daughters a big hug! I cant say enough about Kayti and how she made our stay awesome. We love this hotel and look forward to seeing Kayti next year. Our room was always immaculately cleaned, valet and bell service was always prompt and any request we made was immediately fulfilled. My family also loved the complimentary flavored fruit water and fruit and snack bar the hotel has in the lobby. This hotel is conveniently located in downtown SD, everything in downtown is within walking distance, no need to drive with such wonderful weather. Parking fee is a little high.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - definitely recommend!”
Reviews.Author: chulovilla
Reviews.Content: This was a "nice" hotel at a really good price - nothing fancy or special, but nice and clean!!! Comfy beds and good service. Great central location for getting everywhere. Lots of parking options around the hotel so you do not have to pay the $32 valet if you do not want to. We used the one across the street and the free meters on weekends. Emerald Cafe on the corner was absloutely fabulous for grabbing a quick breakfast and very reasonable. I'm sure lunch would be just as good. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great bed, pool, customer service but poor housekeeping.”
Reviews.Author: msylee22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to take one last weekend trip before our baby is born. I'm about 7 mths pregnant and so didn't want to travel very far, so we settled on San Diego for our getaway. We had stayed at the Westin Princeville in Kauai last year and had the best time so I was really excited to stay at a Westin again. The smell of the toiletries definitely made me reminisce about Kauai. But of course, this was a totally different experience. For starters, we knew about the $32 valet parking, and so parked in an open lot on C street for $5/day. We had a very warm welcome from Kayti Koelln at the front desk. I asked her for a fridge for the room and I don't think she was able to get me one, but sent up really great cookies and a couple of bottles of apple juice instead along with a hand-written note. Nice! Already more hospitable than Kauai. She also asked for my SPG card and reminded me the waters were free and gave us a Preferred floor room. Nice! The room was average for a 4 star hotel, nothing spectacular. You could tell it was an older building that went through a renovation. And our view was of the skyscraper next door that was under construction. Not that I cared so much since there was no balcony to lounge on anyway. A balcony facing the ocean would've been nice, I guess. Some good things: 1. Being 7mths pregnant and forgetting all my pillows at home, I still had a great night sleep in the Heavenly Bed. The bed was comfy and had this long thin pillow that was great for supporting my belly and between my legs. 2. The fitness area was new and nice 3. The pool was nicely heated to almost body temperature, loved it for easy lap swimming 4. There were towels next to the pool 5. 5 block walk to Gaslamp Quarters 6. 1/2 walk to Seaport village 7. Guest services very responsive when you call them. Some bad things: 1. There was hair that was not mine in more than one place in the bathroom. I know it wasn't mine because I saw it there when I first walked in. There was some on a white towel and some on the tub. I used to camp a lot, so I still used the towels. But man, this is supposed to be a luxury hotel 2. There were flecks of black stuff on the hand towel. What are we cleaning, housekeepers? 3. There are these three things of fruity infused water in the front lobby but every time I tried to get some they were empty! It doesn't help to have the things there to tease us. Put some water in them! 4. Walking back from a movie late at night (around 11:30), there are some weird, crazy people who lurk right outside the hotel and talk to you or the air. Kinda creepy. 5. $32 valet parking 6. You have to pay for wifi and use of business center. 7. Bedside lamp did not work, burnt out bulb?

Reviews.Title: “I will stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: frankstser
Reviews.Content: Guest services is always friendly and helpful.. One employee in particular, Giana Johnson went out of her way to make me feel comfortable and welcomed. She is warm and very hospitable. Giana is a valuable employee to the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not necessarily kid friendly”
Reviews.Author: sonnyB12
Reviews.Content: I am an SPG member and planning a trip to San Diego, phoned to ask which of the Westin hotels there would be best with kids. I was told this one. When we arrived, I couldn't figure out why. While we could walk to the water, the Westin Gaslamp was closer to the mall, the baseball field, etc. The pool is tiny, but this is to be expected as the Westin in downtown.

Reviews.Title: “I will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: soprecious17
Reviews.Content: Although I am a local, sometimes I just need to get away from it all & "exhale". The Westin San Diego is the place where I do just that. The rooms are great, the price is right and the people at the front desk take customer service to a different level. One person who stood out the most was a young lady named Giana Johnson. She was very friendly & helpful...especially when I mentioned that I had forgotten my bodywash & needed to purchase some. She gave me some & asked if I needed anything else. She's also very pretty.Again...I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, would love to stay again!”
Reviews.Author: bamagirl1953
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business for 8 nights! Wonderful staff, whatever you needed they provided. Rooms were luxurious and clean. The Heavenly Bed (Westin trademark) was so comfortable. I hated leaving!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay, made a birthday weekend even more special”
Reviews.Author: slynnlo777
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night 7/30/2011 thru 7/31/2011 for a short weekend San Diego getaway to celebrate Godmothers birthday. When I made the reservation, I noted that we were in town celebrating a birthday. When checking in, the person at the front desk wished the birthday person a happy birthday. Later that afternoon a knock at the door from room service brought us a pleasant birthday surprise which included a nice card from the hotel staff, assorted cheese plate with crackers and two bottles of sparkling water. A very nice touch to a pleasant stay and friendly hotel staff. This was my first visit at the Westin (I normally frequent Sheraton Marina another Starwood hotel) and I will definitely be back. I booked the Westin weekend escape package which offered, complimentary breakfast (nice hotel breakfast buffet which included an assortment of warm breakfast items like eggs benedict, potatoes, oatmeal, scrambled eggs, fresh omelets to order, French toast, and assortment of breads, and fruit) and an extended check out time of 4:00 p.m. My only gripe was the $32 a night valet parking fee, but aside from that we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend the hotel to others. Great for families, couples and friends! Stayed in room number 1618 great view of the city and bay with Coronado off in the distance. Thank you Westin!!! Tips for the traveler: Give valet a call 5 minutes before heading down for car. -Search for Westin coupon codes before making a reservation. -Become starwood rewards member for free. Provided for two bottles of drinking water each day ($10 value) and a complimentary appetizer with the purchase of a drink in the hotel bar. Stacy L

Reviews.Title: “A fine stay in a good location”
Reviews.Author: TravelingT1
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights in August and the funny thing is I'd been there before I just didn't remember until the cab dropped me off! Pros - Good location, walkable to the shopping mall and convention center - free airport shuttle - nice view, from bay room - they have a great list of forgotten items that they will give you if you forgot something, from shaving cream to nail polish remover Cons -At 2 pm housekeeping still hadn't come - a bit noisy - there was a hair in my shower, and it wasn't mine Overall this was a fine hotel, got a good nights sleep and was only 10 mins from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms - close to everything spot”
Reviews.Author: DillyScarlet
Reviews.Content: Very nice Westin, in the business district but a 10 minute walk from the bay (Midway and other museum ships), Gaslamp area and 10 minute ride from airport. Hotel has an airport shuttle. Staff was very accommodating, ask for a high room with water view and try to avoid construction across street (not that bad really). Terrific bedding and bath, TV a bit far from the bed, but excellent desk to work on. I would recommend over Westin Gaslamp just because it is not in the Gaslamp area. That area is great fun: dozens of various types of restaurants, clubs, cigar and wine bars, shopping and lots of late night noise. This Westin is much quieter, the only traffic in the lobby are guests and staff - I felt very, very safe.

Reviews.Title: “World Wide Conference- Awesome hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: llruiz235
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin from July 24 thru July 29. My hotel experience was awesome. Randy(banquets), Ricardo (in room dining) and the hotel staff was awesome. I thorougly enjoyed my stay the hotel staff was one of the best in the hospitality industry. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who want quality service. Lisa Ruiz (San Antonio, Tx)

Reviews.Title: “A Relaxing Sanctuary from the Comic-Con Madness!”
Reviews.Author: thegreatkatsby
Reviews.Content: Comic-con is a lot of fun, but there are a lot of people crammed into one convention center. Racing around to get to panels, waiting in line, and putting up with the crowds in general can be exhausting... so it was amazing to be able to come back to our room at the Westin where everything was clean, beautiful, and peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “Comic Con in Comfort and Class!”
Reviews.Author: ElaDarling
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during Comic Con with some friends and we had such a lovely time. The beds are super comfy, the rooms are spacious and clean, the staff is very welcoming and kind, and the bellmen are AWESOME. Mark Drahuschak was the perfect bartender- helpful and smart and very kind. He made my occasional repose in the hotel lounge the perfect escape from the insanity of the convention center. This place goes above and and beyond excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “We were very comfortable staying here...the beds very comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: annette40_11
Reviews.Content: We spent a week on vacation and stayed in four different hotels throughout our road trip, but the most comfortable stay was at this hotel. The other hotels were also 3 and 4 star hotels, however the quality was just not the same. The beds were so comfortable, it was almost as comfortable as home.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: jbg7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 days at the Westin. We had a car with us and had little choice but, to use their valet service. We found it rather expensive at $32 a day, however this seems to be the standard price at most hotels. The valet staff were great and were always friendly and helpful. Check in was quick and easy and the staff were again friendly and helpful. We had a standard room on the 7th floor. The room was spacious and clean. The bed was large and very comfy. There was a work desk and comfy lounge chair. A good selection of channels on TV. There was a mini bar fridge but, with no items in it. This was fine with us as we filled it with items we wanted. The bathroom was clean and spacious. The heavenly shower head was nice also. Internet was reasonably priced in the room at $12 for 24hrs or alternatively it was free in the lobby. The only thing we didn't like was the adjoining room door. Nothing major but, something we would have preferred not to have. However, in fairness we soon got use to it and forgot it was there after time. We used the gym daily. There was a good selection of modern cardio and weight machines. The pool and spa were nice also. We didn't eat at the restaurant but did have a drink and nibbles at the bar. Despite earlier negative reviews we found the bar area to be relaxing and comfortable and the staff to be friendly. Food and beverages were reasonably priced. The location was central for what we had planned during our stay. Most things were within walking distance and those that weren't we had a car. Overall we liked the staff and our room during our stay at the Westin. Some of the complaints made by other reviewers we believe are petty and uncalled for. We would happily stay here again and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Theo46_11
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to San Diego. The free shuttle collected us from the airport within minutes of our arrival. Check in was slick. Nice touch with flavored water and snacks in lobby. Room was ready before the official check in time. The room was well appointed. Wife impressed with the bath robe in bathroom. Quality king size bedding. Nice Starbucks coffee. lovely lounge area and helpful staff. Watch out for water in the room at $5 per bottle. Regrettably no fridge in room and internet comes at $12.95 per day. In close proximity to shopping, Gas Lamp as well as Little Italy restaurants and harbor area. Altogether a nice experience and can certainly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “EVERY COUPLE NEED TO GET AWAY AND PLAY.”
Reviews.Author: ettroae
Reviews.Content: MELISSA was the ASSOCIATE who cheked us in to our room.She knew the city and pointed us to the best sights in town.From the ZOO to the HARBOR for GREAT FOOD to the MALL,and the wonderful BEACHES. Then she gave us ROOM 1518. THE VIEW was more than we hoped for. WE WATCH THE FIREWORKs FOR OUr HOTEL BED. I did not like the rubber bath mats. you can slip and fall. I did not like my keys going dead, but I did like that they can to me and did not ask me to come back down to the desk.

Reviews.Title: “So-So Stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: FireMedicSteve
Reviews.Content: On the positive side, this is a Westin brand hotel. The Heavenly Shower (two shower heads), updated decor, and large room were all very nice. On the negative side, the hotel shuttle kept me waiting at the airport for almost an hour (then, the driver called me a liar), the front desk tried to overcharge me $68/day, and the hotel is a very long walk to the convention center, Petco Park, and the heart of the Gaslamp Quarter. The trashcan had not been emptied when I checked-in and some amenities, like body wash in the shower, first arrived four days after I arrived. Overall, I would have been just as happy at the hotel/hostel next door for 1/3 of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok - not typical Westin”
Reviews.Author: RiverOaksReviewer
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine, but nothing impressive and definitely the most outdated Westin I have seen. The location was perfect for several of the touristy spots in the area and the price was reasonable. The best experience we had at the hotel was a nice breakfast with excellent service. The dark and cramped room left much to be desired. I expect better at a Westin. The night we checked in I went to get ice, and found that someone had left a catering box with a tuna sandwich rotting in the ice room on our floor. Two days later when we checked out that trash had still not been cleaned up even though the smell could be detected throughout the entire hallway. Disgusting!!

Reviews.Title: “I was told not to fill out a customer servey”
Reviews.Author: StraujaFam
Reviews.Content: Honestly I was not impressed by the hotel. The rooms aren't impressive, bedding is average, and the bar was horrible. I went there to get some dessert to bring up to the room and even though the lady (who was covering for the bartender) was very sweet and kind, she seemed frazzled and like she wasn't sure what she was doing......30 minutes after ordering, I received my frozen tiramisu, which when I complained, she was told by a kitchen staff that that is how it was supposed to be served. I was compensated for it by a wonderful breakfast and was very pleasantly surprised by that........I would have had no complaints, but then as I was checking out, the lady at the front desk asked how my stay was...when I gave her my honest opinion, she asked me NOT to fill out the questionnaire because at this time they have good reviews...not only was I offended by this, but I was totally taken back by the lack of professionalism and unethical business etiquette. When I think of the Westin, I think of words like: posh, professional, fancy, classy. After this stay, unfortunately, it has changed my opinion of the hotel:(

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel. Parking way overpriced at $32 night.”
Reviews.Author: w0rldtravelers99
Reviews.Content: Great area. Could use some updates in lobby. Overall nice. Won't recommend though because of insane parking fees.

Reviews.Title: “No luxury here. No minibars. Outdated rooms. Pretty disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: imustcreate
Reviews.Content: This property was pretty disappointing & certainly didn't live up to the luxury experience that Westin touts in all of it's marketing campaigns. My husband & I checked in at 11pm, after a late flight, only to find that our prepaid Deluxe room had in fact NOT been prepaid due to an "error with the system". We booked the room several weeks prior, but were not ever informed of this (even after I called to confirm the reservation 3 days prior to arrival and was told everything was all set). We were unexpectedly charged $450 on the spot with no apologies from the staff on the error, and no explanation as to a breakdown of the charges. The desk clerk simply swiped our card, mumbled something inaudible, and then handed us the room keycards, without even pointing us to the elevators. Not a very impressive welcome for a supposedly upscale hotel chain. This particular trip was to celebrate my husband's birthday, which the reservation rep put into the notes when I called to book our room. But no one at the hotel ever took notice of this. I've never been to an upscale hotel for a birthday event where the staff didn't go out of their way to help us celebrate the special event, or at least SAY happy birthday. Additionally, we booked the Westin Deluxe room, as we were told it would be nicer than the standard Westin room. We did have a nice view, but the room looked very outdated, and it had NO minibar! Only a gigantic empty minibar cabinet. I am not sure how any property can call themselves "luxury" when the only in-room amenities offered are shampoo, coffee and water. I'm pretty sure the Econo Lodge offers it's guests more than this. We were very disappointed. The wall insulation in the rooms is appalling. If you are like me, and don't enjoy hearing your neighbors gargle, brush their teeth, and blow-dry their hair at 7am on your vacation, then DO NOT STAY HERE. My husband and I travel quite a bit, and we value more upscale properties and spend quite a bit of time choosing more reputable, luxury brands. We are not looking for a "cheap stay", and have no problem paying more to get more. But after this experience at the Westin San Diego, we will never stay at another Westin again, as it it obvious they certainly don't uphold their brand promises at all hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Locked out Twice over July 4th”
Reviews.Author: azrayne10
Reviews.Content: First let me say that overall, I really enjoyed my visit over July 4th weekend. I loved the price I paid, I loved the Heavenly bed and the dual-headed shower, and the shampoo/conditioner scent. The location is conveinent to most areas of San Diego and I only used my car to take someone to the airport. and to head out to Shelter Island for the SailUSA11 tour. Used the ferry, 4 blocks away to get to Coronado Island and my feet to get to Gaslamp and the trolley system next door to get to Old Town. I was in a weird room at the end of the hallway and there was an extra exterior door that my room and another shared. Well that door closed when I went for ice. No worries as I had my room key. However, it was missing the complete inards to have the key work. I called the front desk for help and they sent up a room attendant. He promptly realized there was nothing he could do. Another call to engineer and to get someone up to open the door. 20 minutes later., I'm in....no follow-up call from front desk apologizing or anything. Moving forward 2 days....I return from the airport only to find that my key is not working in the door. I go down and have it re-keyed, get back to the room only to have the key still not work. This time I call the front desk and they send security up. He tries several times and he tries to use his pass key, and still it doesn't work. He again calls engineering. Apparently the doors electronic locks run on batteries and when they die, they have to get 'shocked" into working and then the batteries have to be changed. So after 30 minutes this time, still no phone call apologizing, nothing....not a sorry for the PITA this was again. Disappointing customer service follow-up......hotel comfy....valet parking $$$ there is no free parking anywhere close by. Might suggest that all SPG receive free wireless in-room internet, Omni does in San Diego for their preferred guest program.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, wonderful service!”
Reviews.Author: CardsFan50
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful first time stay at your beautiful hotel!!! I definetly will return. When we arrived at the airport I called for the shuttle. We were picked up by Eric. You have a wonderful employee there!! He was very friendly and informative. He chatted with us all the way to the hotel about the Cardinals-Padres games that we were there to see. He was also very informative in pointing out things of interest along the way from the airport and directions for us to get to Petco and other places we wanted to go. He also greeted and joked with us (about being Cardinal fans) everytime he saw us during our stay! He is a true delight, and a true assest to your hotel!! The entire staff was excellent, but Eric really stood out to us with his excellent personalized customer service!! We also really liked the flavored water selection you offer in the lobby. It is very refreshing after walking around downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay; great location to visit a variety of sites in San Diego, CA”
Reviews.Author: Pikake2010
Reviews.Content: We just spent 4th of July weekend at the Westin, San Diego. Like a review done around the same time, we ended up at the wrong Westin too. The Gaslight Westin is just blocks from the Downtown one and after already valeting the car and getting to the front desk we had wished we could have just switched hotels, however, I'm glad we got back into our car and went to the Downtown Westin, the one we had booked. It is a great location to see the sites of San Diego. We were able to walk to Seaport Village (took a pedal cab back which was fun; cab took us through the gaslight district at night), walked to the blue line trolley to go to Old Town for sightseeing and lunch, walked to LIttle Italy for a fun Farmer's Market (on Saturdays only), and it was close to the zoo but had to drive. The hotel view was nice. We had a corner room. Only complaint was the drain didn't work that great and the water backed up and drained slowly but we liked the room so we just lived with it and didn't report it. Liked the two headed shower head. Didn't like the little room where the toilet and bath/shower was in (sliding door to close). It was pretty small and there wasn't anywhere to put your things. We managed though. The rest of the room was nice and spacious. Enjoyed the fruit flavored ice water in the lobby. One had pineapple in it, another had grapefruit, and the third had cantaloupe. Really refreshing and am going to try that at home. Didn't try out the gym but did walk around the neighborhood. Seemed safe enough. Some transients near the greyhound and train station but it was ok and I did feel safe. The staff at the hotel were nice and it was nice to see that the hotel was doggie friendly. In fact the town seems pretty doggie friendly. Saw a hugh sign at the Horton plaza shopping center - stating that dogs are welcome. Have never seen that before. We will go back to this hotel the next time we are in San Diego. Could be nice to take the train instead of driving too. The train station is just blocks from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in downtown san diego”
Reviews.Author: Martyhoyt
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel over the fourth of july holiday and was very satisfied with this hotel. I got in to san diego late and went to the hotel after I got my rental car. I checked in around one forty five in the morning. The valet attendant was very helpful even at this later hour. I went and checked in and the clerk was also very courteous and friendly also at this late hour. The room I was given was on the twentieth floor at no additional charge with a view of the bay. Also the valet that park the vehicles were very eager to help I even saw one run across the street to get a vehicle and I was impressed by his willingness to give prompt service. The parking charge is a little steep at thirty two bucks a day but what are you going to do and I doubt the other four star hotels in downtown are much cheaper so is not that big of a deal. Also the dual shower heads are a nice touch. Also I got the price on priceline for one hundred ten so I was very satisfied especially over the forth of july holiday. I definatly would stay here again. One other thing it is kind of a pain to get here if you are following a gps because you have to go around the block to get to the valet parking but this is not the hotels fault

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: mateowalrus
Reviews.Content: I got the chance to stay at the westin san diego and I was very pleased. When I arrived at the hotel I thought this whole trip would be a disaster being that I realized upon check in that I was at the wrong westin. How many Westins could there be in a few block radius I thought? Turns out there's two. As you can imagine I was a bit frustrated when I arrived at the correct hotel. That quickly changed. Katie and melissa at the front desk assured me that it wasn't just me who made that mistake and quickly got my mind off of it and eased my troubles away through casual conversation. They both recognized me the rest of my stay and went out of their way to say hello each time they saw me. If this is how service was all the time, I would stay at hotels much more often. Thanks melissa and katie!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, very nice room.”
Reviews.Author: wanttotravelmore1
Reviews.Content: Came to San Diego for vacation and also to celebrate our Anniversary. We usually stay at the Westin Gaslamp, but made an error in booking. This Westin was just as nice and still centrally located to everything. Melissa checked us in and was very nice. When she heard that we were celebrating she gave us breakfast passes for our stay and drink tickets for the bar. We had such a nice relaxing time. We can always count on Westin to be clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Soothing service!”
Reviews.Author: Meret17
Reviews.Content: I was foolish enough to get badly sunburned on my recent trip to San Diego, and ended up stuck in my room for a whole day. Marina and Cynthia of the Room Service staff were so nice to me- they brought me a bottle of Aloe-Vera when the delivered my dinner - and wouldn't take payment for it! I felt so much better inside and out! Thank you Marina and Cynthia!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: bluejem301
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the staff of the Weston. Your bartender, Mark, gave use great advice on where to eat and getting us reservations. All staff were very helpful and friendly in answering our questions.

Reviews.Title: “functional and close to airport.”
Reviews.Author: Swisswifey
Reviews.Content: OK. hotel. A little tired, functional, and close to the airport. Kinda strange that we booked in as husband and wife and in lieu of them being able to give us lounge access they gave us ONE drink voucher...... We got a VERY warm welcome from the receptionist on Friday 17th June late evening. I can't remember her name but she was a young girl and was incredibly helpful and friendly an asset to the hotel !!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Great time! Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: cookieintx
