So much for four star service. Although the breakfast buffet was OK, we absolutely hated it when the wait staff came up to us at the end of our meal and gave us a card with their names on it. Text on the back of the card explained that if we mentioned the server by name on TripAdvisor, they'd get a bonus from their employer, Westin Hotels. They directly asked us to write a positive personal review on this site. Sorry guys, but that's not how it works in our books. First you want a tip for a breakfast buffet...where guests serve themselves...and THEN you overtly ask for free advertising and more perks? Having stayed in hundreds of hotels over the years, I have never seen anything so tacky. I'm not sure where pride in doing a good job, a positive customer service ethic and professionalism comes in - but at the Westin San Diego, the staff''s 'it's all about me' attitude ensured that the guest always came second during our stay. I am surprised that a well known brand like the Westin encourages this practice, which is not in keeping with the subtle but excellent service standards of its competitors. If you want to be treated like a valued guest...stay somewhere else in downtown San Diego. There are plenty of hotels nearby where your custom will be appreciated

Reviews.Title: “Was hoping for a perfect experience, but didn't pan out as hoped”
Reviews.Author: Phoenix_AZMkim
Reviews.Content: Overall the stay was OKAY, not fantastic though. Our connecting room was not ready when we checked in close to 4pm. I called a week before our arrival to make sure that rooms would be ready because we were traveling a long way with two small children. I was assured that rooms would be ready, but they were not. Our front desk person was not very kind either. He was indifferent to my frustrations and did not offer any suggestions other than to sit and wait. He also told us that the rooms would be ready in about an hour, but they were ready 10 minutes after he told us it would be an hour. I'm glad that we decided to wait in the lobby and not leave the hotel. The room was clean and comfortable, which made things better. However, there was no mini bar frig, as advertised, and the television channels were terrible. We had to BUY kid appropriate television programs for my children. We went to the restaurant for breakfast on both mornings of our stay and the service and food was terrible. The host, manager and servers were completely unaware that there were guests in the restaurant. We had to actually get up and make a request for a server on several occasions. The food on the buffet was cold, stale and unappetizing. My husband and I ended up ordering off the menu on the second morning. We also had dinner in the hotel and that experience was much better. Our server was very attentive and the food was okay. This is the second Westin I've been to and both experiences have not been good. I don't think I'll stay in another Westin property. It looks great in the advertisements, but once you actually get there it's a totally different situation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bartelprint2
Reviews.Content: Breakfast Buffet is WAY TO EXPENSIVE!! Breafast meats were dried out and we had to ask for our eggs anyway we wanted them instead of the waitress asking us if we wanted any eggs or waffles!! incredible staff except for the waitress at the Breakfast Buffet

Reviews.Title: “The Westin Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: sc1313
Reviews.Content: It was New Year's Eve and chaos ensued. Not only did the front desk take care of my lack of sleep on NYE due to faulty door locks but they compensated us with an upgrade and some d'lish breakfast. We thought we were too late to enjoy breakfast but Juan Verduzco made sure that we had our fill and we were well taken care of. Great service, great attitude! I will DEFINITELY be back to The Westin for repeat service.

Reviews.Title: “It was my most satisfy stay in the Westin Brand with my recent stays.”
Reviews.Author: funjlee2010
Reviews.Content: I appreciate my stay with this Westin to bring me more positive experience in the SPG program due to recent stays in other properties in Starwood Hotels. Through this stay in this hotel, it brings me back my confiendent to the royal program as well because I was almost to think about the program is no longer to be royality on it since the program going down badly with my recent stays with other properies due to lacking of services and qualities offered to the Elite members. However, the Westin Hotel in San Diego brought me back a confiendent to believe that I am seeing bright future of the program again. I appreciate the stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you can stay anywhere, choose ONLY a Westin Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Silverfoxguy50
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this Westin during a conference a few months ago and found everything at this hotel to be exceptional - service, quality, cleanliness and value. It is in a great location and the staff have consistently been customer-service oriented. Recently, on two separate occasions, I had chosen to stay at a Hilton hotel and both times, the service was less than good and I felt like I was being "nickeled and dimed" by the facilities. After experiencing the Westin, I have vowed that whenever I have the choice between a Hilton and a Westin, I will consistently select a Westin Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb customer service at the Westin San Diego”
Reviews.Author: kimimacCA
Reviews.Content: Our Marketing team recently planned a 2-day offsite staff meeting, and selected the Westin San Diego as our location. Jen Cease, Convention Services Manager, was the consummate professional, answering question after question with patience and cheerfulness. Molly Moran, Concierge, provided fantastic service!! She was always friendly, helpful and prompt in responding to our needs. She went above and beyond in service to our team. Jen, Molly and the entire Westin San Diego team helped make our Marketing staff meeting a complete success. We'd return in a minute!!

Reviews.Title: “I was throroughly impressed with the staff”
Reviews.Author: paganle
Reviews.Content: I organized an offsite meeting for my management team and the Westin staff was extremely professional and accommodating. I was most impressed with the Banquet staff. Baron, Diane, Mark R., and Roman were all very attentive to my needs for the managers. At one point, one of my managers requested a substitute for the lemon cheesecake we had ordered because she had heard several people say that it left much to be desired. Roman immediately returned with a smile and a beautiful display of chocolate cake to distribute. I was very appreciative of her quick adjustment. Similarly, I had a request for chocolate chip cookies and after mentioning it to Diane, we had chocolate chip cookies within minutes. Baron was constantly making sure that all my needs were met and he was very accommodating and professional. Mark R. was quick to make the changes that we needed both professionally and without complaint. I understand that people can be difficult to deal with sometimes, and Mark experienced this with our group. One of my managers was very rude to Mark as he was clearing the dishes from our room. When I went to him to apologize, he was very courteous, assumed the blame upon himself (which was not accurate) and his gracious manner truly impressed me. My "star player" for the trip was Molly. She was stationed in the lobby. I stopped by to ask her about a particular place to go, and she gave me a map, drew me a route, and told me which side of the street to walk on, since it was nighttime. She was helpful, friendly, and she absolutely made my trip, knowing that the Westin employs someone who is concerned with my safety and well-being, considering that I was not familiar with the area. Overall, every question I asked or issue I had was taken care of both professionally and amiably. Caroline McNally was my POC for rooming and she was very helpful as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service from Events Staff”
Reviews.Author: KevinTheGreat
Reviews.Content: My company recently held a half-day seminar at the Westin and we had great support from Randy Rivers, Mark Reiter, and the rest of the banquet/events staff. Will definitely return if we host another seminar in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Westin!”
Reviews.Author: fit4aking
Reviews.Content: The entire staff at The Westin San Diego is excellent. Everyone is so friendly and willing to help. Big thanks to Stephen Kelly at the front desk for making my arrival experience so wonderful. You set the tone for my whole trip. I will be back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The bartender, Mark Drahuschak was great!”
Reviews.Author: gingertate
Reviews.Content: Being from a small town in New Mexico I drink Dr Pepper, even with my rum. The bar did not have rum but Mark had a Dr Pepper of his own and actually opened it for me so I could have my usual drink. He saved me after the long fast paced day I had just spent. He was great. Thank you Mark, Ginger

Reviews.Title: “Less Than Expected.”
Reviews.Author: McDermott0420
Reviews.Content: Westin is usually a very premier place to stay. My wife and I have stayed at various Westin's with better experience than others. This was one that was left to be desired. The rooms are decent, the service was good. The rooms were contemporary but for the price, you can stay in San Diego at The HIlton Bayfront or the Marriot and get a more prestigious and desirable stay with a view.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected happiness / Presidential suite- wow”
Reviews.Author: gen96
Reviews.Content: We had another place in mind at first but canceled and chose here. It was our unexpected happiness. We drove from N. California and had family in the Poway area. We wanted a clean and relaxing place from it all. This was it. But our booking company was misinformed of the parking situation here. We almost wanted to leave. But thankfully Mr. Luke Profancik help clear the matter up. Street parking is free at certain hours of the evening. Just follow the signs. Then a Mr. Rob Glaus continued our check in. He helped us learn the area and made our little ones happy with free kids "exploring" bags. Imagine our surprise, a hotel in this area thinking of our kids. Then another gentlemen (he wore a double button uniform like a bell boy,sorry no name )came to us with a holiday game. Our prize was a free luxury suite upgrade. Wow. The only suite left was the presidential suite - like they would give that to us. But Mr. Rob Glaus did. The suite like the hotel was immaculate & relaxing. Even if we had our original room which was the guest room in that suite - it would have been more than enough. Thank you to the whole team for putting this mom at ease after a stressful beginning. When we come back to visit our family again we know exactly where to stay. Great location, views, hotel , and Staff. We already recommended this to our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “First Negative Comments I've Made Regarding a Hotel Stay All Year”
Reviews.Author: Les2302
Reviews.Content: There was nothing in particular that stood out to cause me to comment that I won't stay at The Westin again; but rather several small things. I wondered about The Westin as I first took the elevator to my room. A group of business ladies commented that they would not stay here again. Before I begin on the negative issues, I would like to report that the Valet personnel were excellent. Though I usually don't use this option, I found all Valet personnel to be friendly, courteous and professional. Most hotels I stay at will ask in advance how many pillows I would like and do I prefer foam or feather. This was not done at your hotel. I felt that the maid must have been ordered to carefully look at the lotion and shampoo bottles to see if a drop could be squeezed out. 4 days with two of us in the room and the lotion and shampoo was never replaced. Towels and wash clothes that had been placed on the side of the tub were left by the maid. Though she did replace them, I didn't understand why she left them. The room usually wasn't made up until mid-afternoon and to be honest, the first day when I returned to my room, I didn't think the maid had been there yet because the bed appeared to be unmade. I then realized she had been in the room, she just didn't do a very good job at making the bed. My wife had left for a run while the made was in the room and when she returned she found that the maid had turned off the A/C. Since it was a fairly warm day in San Diego, she felt this was inappropriate. On our second day, we found that our keys were inoperative when we returned to our room in the early evening. Upon going to the front desk, we were told that they had to reset all the keys. If this was the case, I would have expected someone to have been by the elevators, informing guests of this before they ventured 23 floors up. The front desk clerk didn't offer an apology for the inconvenience. The workout room was very much like a sauna. I was in the gym at 0530 every morning and by 0545 I could see that I wasn't the only one sweating profusely. As I mentioned, I typically send out positive comments and I really don't like reporting on negative experiences, however; I hope that you will consider my comments and make some of the small changes that I feel are necesary. Thanks, Les

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing breakfast”
Reviews.Author: JanWeisman
Reviews.Content: Kelly nortan & Juan Verduzca Jr. Gave us great service at breakfast at the Westin hotel. We were tired from the niight before and they kept our coffee hot and serviced our table by keeping our dishes clear. We even asked for a newspaper, and they went and found us one. What a great way to start our day. Good food and service with a newspaper to read. Thank you! Jan & Lee

Reviews.Title: “Great Service for our event held at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: mundotraveler
Reviews.Content: We held an event at the Westin Emerald last month (November) for an organization, and the entitre staff was great to work with. They were accomodating and very patient with the entire group that was setting up the Emerald Ballroom for the event. One of the banquet servers, Mark Reiter, was exceptionally helpful and kind, and went above and beyond to make our experience at the Westin a pleasant one. As one of the event planners, he truly made my experience so much better. He was not only helpful but also very knowledgeable, efficient, and very respectful towards me and the entire group. He also treated our guests very well. Truly a pleasure to work with. We hope to hold an event at the Westin again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and functional”
Reviews.Author: startrekbonnie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin to attend a conference. The location was perfect! The room was very comfortable and the desk and chair combo with internet access allowed me to continue my work before and after the conference. Service was outstanding. Location was perfect. Excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and great location”
Reviews.Author: Czandra
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Afghanistan and chose the Westin San Diego to decompress and transition back into "regular society." The hotel did not disappoint. The room, especially the comfortable bed and shower were a plus. The jacuzzi was definitely a highlight and very relaxing. Great location just around the corner from the train station and Gaslamp District made it easy to sightsee without having to park anywhere. Great customer service was evident in the restaurant downstairs, especially Juan Verduz who was very attentive to our requests, and also the nightshift valet guy. What a good welcome home from classy San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: bduggan
Reviews.Content: Front Desk Staff member, Sunni Wells, was extremely helpful with my checkin when we encountered an unanticipated limit on my debit card. She was patient and suggested a workable solution for the difficulty. All came out well and there were no further worries.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and comfortable in downtown SD”
Reviews.Author: sundogg99
Reviews.Content: When our tour company was unable to get us a flight out of San Diego on a busy Thanksgiving weekend, they footed the bill for us to spend one night at the Westin San Diego. We checked in quite early on a Sunday morning and checked out late on Monday, and the hotel graciously met our needs on both ends of our stay. In between, we had no complaints either. Our rooms faced south on the 18th floor, with nice views of downtown, the bay, and the Coronado Bridge. We all admired the spa-like decor and everyone loved the incredibly comfortable beds. Housekeeping seemed adequate, the rooms were clean and in good repair, and the noise level was acceptable. We got vouchers for the morning buffet breakfast, which was quite nice, with a great variety of high-quality food choices. We didn't have much interaction with the hotel staff, but the encounters we had were uniformly pleasant. Since we didn't pay for our rooms, I can't speak to the value of this hotel. However, I will say that it was a very pleasant stopover, and I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A clean place to sleep. It's OK.”
Reviews.Author: Nucleoplasty
Reviews.Content: The rooms at this Westin are clean and appear newly renovated. They are decorated with the same materials as most Westins the I have stayed in recently, thus making the stay a bit less fun but expected. This hotel did not have a minibar in the room which is disappointing for a hotel chain that markets their spa like escape experience that the SPG channel claims they have. But unfortunately, this experience really doesn't exist. I recently stayed at a Westin in Chicago which whittled the minibar down to two nips of liquor and really nothing for mixers. As you can tell, I'm disenchanted with the brand which I used to like. Whoever is making the decisions to whittle down the in-room experience and designing all the rooms in a cookie cutter fashion is making a mistake in my view. Even though I am frequent guess, I am choosing not to stay in Westins as the competition is doing a better job. Also there was no concierge as the occupancy was low!

Reviews.Title: “Walls are paper thin”
Reviews.Author: KTOB26
Reviews.Content: I suppose you could have a nice stay there, nice view, good condition, apparently maintained, room was kind of small, but a friendly staff, champagne and strawberries in the room, nice touches. But it all depends on your neighbors. When the drunks came home at 2AM, sounded like they were in my room, and my sleep was shot. I called the front desk 3 separate times to complain, making us feel like an old grumpy couple. That’s exactly the way the wife and I wanted to feel on our anniversary. Slept like crap. If the neighbors were quite, it would have been romantic, I suppose if you stay it’s a gamble on the decibel level. To add insult to injury is when I asked for a comp or something in the AM for the disturbance. I was offered parking (outrageously overpriced at $32). $32 is not worth my sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience-treated as a friend staying at hotel”
Reviews.Author: brainguy
Reviews.Content: On my trips to San Diego I always choose to stay at the Emerald Plaza Westin (formerly Wyndham). Excellent service and great hospitality. Rooms clean and comfortable. Location is idea! My only complaint was the elimination of free internet in lobby area especially when I needed internet for a only 1 hour a day-too expensive to pay for all day service.

Reviews.Title: “OK but Expected a little more”
Reviews.Author: radiationmd
Reviews.Content: For the price they charge and being rated a Four star hotel, you would expect more perks such as free wi fi, but nothing is for free in this hotel. Not even a business center with internet access, which I think is rediculous. The best feature was the comfortable beds. The AC thermostat appears to be a "fake" meaning they give you the impression you can set the temp, but we could not get the Temp in the room below 72, no matter how low we put the AC set to and for how lung. I would go for a gas lamp location next time near 5th avenue. Parking can be a pain if you don't want to pay $30.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible staff and perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: GiuseppeSanfilippo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a conference of mine and I was impressed with the level of service we received onsite. The rooms are very clean and their beds are amazingly comfortable. Also the location of this hotel made it possible for me to go around the around and do some shopping and site seeing at the end of each day. I would like to thank the following people for making my stay a great one: Paul Lotz (you are the best), Diane Nielson, Mark Reiter, Carline McNally, Stephen Kelly, Scott Grosso, Barron and Santiago. Thank you all again :-)

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: LRod7
Reviews.Content: Westin is a known hotel for great service, great amenties, etc. We were part of a wedding party that all of the guest stayed at the Westin. This is why I was very surprised to see a few things in our room that I was not pleased with. In the bathroom the floors were stained with a clear liquid not certain what it would have possible be. In the bathtub the water spout was very loose, when I was ready to use the shower head I pulled the little lever and the whole thing moved along with it. The light fixture next to the bed did not work properly, when I turned it on all it did was flicker. The iron had some kind of white substance that left that same white substance on my fiance's shirt. Thank you...

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculous Valet Parking charge”
Reviews.Author: mmn0929
Reviews.Content: Terrific Room. Great Bed. Good room Service. Comfortable chair in room. TOTALLY RIDICULOUS amount that I was charged for Valet Parking. Had I known up front how much that was going to be, I would have taken a shuttle. I would recommend this hotel, but only after I had warned them abuot the $32 daily valet charge.

Reviews.Title: “Well Located Down Town Hotel even though you have to go around the block to get there”
Reviews.Author: vagent711
Reviews.Content: The address of the hotel is on Broadway but the entrance is on Columbia so when using GPS you have to go down a block left for two, then left another two in order to be going the correct way on the one way streets. The entrance area is very small and the valet service was severely understaffed for this meeting. Jesse the bellman was very helpful and friendly, and the young lady who worked the lounge during the afternoons was very customer service oriented. The rooms are spacious and well appointed and the cable service adaquate. My constant complaint of this and other hotels in it's high priced range is the requirement to pay daily for wi-fi in the room. Conference rooms were good and the waitstaff attentive. The outdoor pool is very small but the workour area is large and very well equipped.

Reviews.Title: “service”
Reviews.Author: lnoelg
Reviews.Content: When I checked in I was told that there should be a complimentary bottle of water in the room. I never got it and just forgot about it. The bathroom had a hanger for a bathrobe without a bathrobe. I called housekeeping about that and they sent 1 up. I ordered room service for a gorgonzola(?) pear salad and was given caesar salad. These little mishaps are annoying and should never really happen in your establishment. I never expected things like this to happen and I certainly will try to avoid this hotel as much as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service!”
Reviews.Author: lms22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin for a conference in November. We couldn't have asked for a better stay. The hotel was clean and spacious. The location was great. The San Diego Symphony, the Harbor and Horton Plaza were all within walking distance and the trolley was just a block away if we wanted to go a little further. All of the staff at the hotel were super friendly and helpful from the door man to the meeting managers. Paul Lotz, our convention services manager, was absolutely fabulous. Whenever we needed something, he was there. He made sure our conference ran smoothly and that our staff was happy for the whole week. The assistant front desk manager, Luke, was awesome on our first day when everyone was checking in. Through out the week he and Carolyn McNally, the reservations manager, were able to help me on the spot for all of my requests. Randy Rivers, one of our banquet captains, also took good care of us, making sure we our food and beverages were adequately stocked but not overstocked. That was really nice since we are watching our budget. I would definitely love to come back, the service was exceptional!

Reviews.Title: “Service makes the difference”
Reviews.Author: mpaniccia
Reviews.Content: A short stay for a conference in San Diego was made so much more enjoyable by their front desk staff, and I'd like to mention Besa Aliti specifically. Friendly, professional, and spot on in her recommendations for restaurants and a cigar bar (not an easy thing in California, apparently). The hotel itself has just about everything, and is a short walk to everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Well-trained staff & welcoming ambience”
Reviews.Author: eileeneeo
Reviews.Content: The Westin is well located and close to many San Diego attractions including the waterfront, old town and Horton Plaza. The rooms are good size and nicely appointed. The amenities high quality. The staff is friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. The Westin is a fine choice for a business stay or vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Average-to-good but standard.”
Reviews.Author: A_Travel_Opinion
Reviews.Content: Location to the Gaslamp Quarter was our favorite feature of the hotel. Room and hotel was standard but good, sort of forgettable. For a Westin, our room was not up to par--carpet was ripped and stained. Nothing in the minibar. Room needed upgrading, overall. Comfortable beds. Okay view. Friendly and professional staff. We didn't have a bad experience, but we would pick a different hotel on a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great personal service, weak infrastructure”
Reviews.Author: In79days
Reviews.Content: The staff were very helpful, and very friendly, but I had to change rooms at 4 am because of the noise from the plumbing. It was so loud, I thought it was a fire alarm, and actually ran out into the corridor. Returning to my room at 7pm, it had not been cleaned, but the manager was helpful, and got someone up right away. However, not really up to normal Westin Stanf=dards, especially as sleep and rest is the chains big selling point.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: DrMikie
Reviews.Content: I was coming to San Diego for a conference. I am a loyal Starwood guy and checked out this Westin. I got a rate way better than the official conference hotel and booked it. Not disappointed! Nice scale. Very pleasant place. Courteous, helpful staff. Great room with super view. Could not have been happier with my choice. Will stay here again next time I'm in town.

Reviews.Title: “Living Up To High Standards”
Reviews.Author: SanfurdNSon
Reviews.Content: I work for the Performance Institute located in Washington, DC. We frequently use the Westin San Diego as the site for our West Coast events. I have stayed at Westins in the past-- the most salient being the Westin in Coral Gables, FL. Thus, my performance expectations were very high. The convention and food services staffs were AMAZING to work with. The afternoon I arrived, the convention services manager, Jen Cease, reached out to ME so that we could meet and go over any questions or issues I had prior to the first day of the conference. Not to mention, she provided me with a fruit & cheese platter as a token of appreciation for our service. This customer-centric attitude was also perpetuated by the rest of the staff members who were as equally accommodating. They were informed that I was a little "green" at hosting off-site events and subsequently took the necessary steps to eliminate any obstacles that would inhibit the flow of the conference. Needless to say, everything ran smoothly. The staff members that contributed to my outstanding experience are as follows: Jen and Byron from convention services, Randy from food service, and Ray, the one and only AV person (at the time). This group is a model of customer service and clearly understand that customers are what drive the business. This is a very personable staff who treated me with respect and spoke to me not only as a customer, but also as a friend. I look forward to seeing everyone again when I return to the hotel for our January 2011 conference.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: iris0726
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. The staff at the front desk name Besa Alitias is extremely helpful with good tips on where to eat and how to get around. She always keep smiling.The rooms were cleanliness and comfortable. Just 2 min walk to trolley station.

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: mokum58
Reviews.Content: Checked in early after returning from our cruise. "Yes,we have a room ready for you"made our day. All of the employees just made us feel welcome and helped us to enjoy our stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Another good experience”
Reviews.Author: drc225
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in late October at the rate of $169 plus tax for a convention. I think this was the convention rate. Second time I've stayed. It was another good experience. Room is fine, comfortable and has a good proper business chair at the desk. There is plenty of local (expensive) parking. I didn't really use hotel facilities other than the bar for a quick evening meal when i got in. As for most hotels like this one the bar was overpriced and much better value would have been had going somewhere else. Internet was $12.95 +tax per night - didn't use it as I have mobile broadband for circumstances like this one. No doubt I'll be back again next year.

Reviews.Title: “The Westin has all the amenities and small touches a traveler could imagine.”
Reviews.Author: maggiemae55
Reviews.Content: I love the Westin's heavenly beds and linens; makes being away from home a comfortable pleasure. Down to the drapery and modern pillow touches, westin's rooms are homey. One of the smallest things westin does is put out cool water carafes with sliced fruit in them, readily available in the lobby on your way in or out. I don't know if it is intentional but the water goes perfectly with the refresh/hydrate spa theme of the Westin. These large and small details are what sets Westin apart in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Thoughtful and caring staff”
Reviews.Author: pwr2spr
Reviews.Content: The staff was thoughtful and attentive. Both at the front desk as well as the support staff. Bertha made that extra effort every day.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: af847
Reviews.Content: The place is clean and mostly updated. Bathroom and bed areas of my room were immaculate. Glad to see electrical outlets actually in the work desk. Little things like that make a stay easier. What I did notice was the helpful staff. Restaurant server Marites was outstanding in her friendly, professional service, but everybody else was great too. Location is so-so, but then everything is close in San Diego. I'd stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Westin Gaslamp, not this one”
Reviews.Author: Juice98
Reviews.Content: Easy to get to from the San Diego airport. Big, corporate looking hotel in the business district. Needs some updating...elevator buttons do not light up and plating is all scratched up. Gaslamp has a better location for restaurants, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Best Westin Ever”
Reviews.Author: rileigh15
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel and was immediately impressed with the kind young woman who helped me check into the hotel. She was pleasant in all pleasantries... and I soon found out that every single person employed at this hotel is the same. Without exception, I found everyone to be helpful, forthcoming, and thinking outside the box. The staff is just superb. Other than the employees, though, it is really a great hotel. I stay at Starwood hotels often and this one was above par. Their foyer/atrium rose to multiple floors and the glass elevators literally went through the ceiling, creating stunning views. The business center, fitness area, and all common areas were just at the standard you would expect from a Westin, which is to say, were great. They were all modern, well-maintained, and easy to access. The rooms themselves were also highly comfortable. There was adequate space, abundant resources of utilities and necessities, and are again very modern. The entire experience was just as comfortable as could be. I was upgraded to a bay-view room, affording me nice sights. I enjoyed watching the boats and the sunsets. The location was also better than I expected. On my last trip to San Diego, I stayed at the Westin in the Gas Lamp quarter, so this time I was expecting a bit of a walk to get to that area. However, the city blocks are small and this hotel is only about 10 minutes' walk from the same Gas Lamp area. It was a pleasant walk, too, and in a very safe area, well-lit, and easily navigated. There were multiple restaurants and convenience stores nearby, as well as a trolley station, so everything was easily accessed. There is even a micro brewery located one block away. The airport, too, was only about 10 minutes away by car, but I was never even awoken by noise! All-in-all, this is a fabulous hotel. I liked it better than the other Westin I mentioned, too.

Reviews.Title: “loud and obnoxious neighbors in adjoining room”
Reviews.Author: BruceMacGurn
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and nice, however, several times we were awoken in the middle of the night to loud and obnoxious neighbors. We called the front desk and hotel security was sent to give warnings, but the noise continued. It was not a restful 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Concierge”
Reviews.Author: cathieprochaska
Reviews.Content: We needed recommendations for restaurants and highlights of what to do with just 3 days of vacation in San Diego. Molly, the conceirge at the Westin suggested restaurants that exceeded our expectations! She is extremely knowledgable with the entire San Diego area and assisted us in putting together a fabulous itenarary for our stay. Molly is by far the best concierge we have ever met. She made our trip very successful with her outstanding customer service and friendly/professional personality.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to say, amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: caitlinnicole1988
Reviews.Content: The service from the staff was exceptional! They were very helpful in recommending places to eat and things to go do while we were in town. The room was beautiful, a little small, but very nice. The bed was AMAZING. There was some construction going on across the street so it was a little unsightly to see the large crane and worksite out our window, but we never noticed an increase in noise.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here.”
Reviews.Author: 3labsinA2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a major national convention. The location is not very good, the bathrooms had mold and the staff was rude and very unhelpful. If you are in town for an event at the convention center there are hotels with much better location and I have to assume much better staff. Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else. I am giving this hotel 1 star because zero is not an option.

Reviews.Title: “Very good downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: SFJohnny
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights with my partner and the visit was really just for pleasure. Hotel location was good if downtown is your choice. Rooms were clean, modern, and the bed was wonderful, really comfortable. Only downside was the lack of a refrigerator or minibar, at least in our ninth floor room. Housekeeping was excellent - special thanks to Ma Elena who couldn't have been more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant place to stay during conference”
Reviews.Author: Devinka
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights during a conference that my husband participated at. To start with location: the hotel is right in the city centre, close to the Gas Lamp Quarter, or the seaside. Thanks to the very well organized public transportation it was no problem to get anywhere, the train station being just approx. 5 minutes by walk from the hotel. It is quite easy to get to the Sea World, or to go for shopping – very practical, when your husband is at the conference and you have the whole day for yourself! Although being close to the sea, this is not the place where you could actually swim – there is no beach nearby, just the port. So if you really wish to go to the beach, take a ferry to the Coronado island (from the port being just 10 mins by walk from the hotel). You can have a nice 20 mins walk accross the island to get to the Coronado hotel – do you remember the movie „Some like it hot“ with Marylin Monroe, Jack Lemon and Tony Curtis? Did you know that „the hotel in Florida“ was actually in San Diego? So, if you love the movie (as much as I do), take a trip to Coronado – you will love it! As regards swimming – I am not sure what the weather usually is there, however, despite we were there at the end of August, the wind was quite cold and we did not feel for swimming at all. Perhaps we just had bad luck... The hotel itself: the rooms were nice and spacy, very clean, with all the comfort. The only thing that we were missing was a minibar. Initially I thought that I might use the hotel swimming pool – however, the weather was not very nice (it was foggy every morning) and the pool was just above a very noisy street and I did not feel this would be the best way for me to relax... So I did not try it at all... Food and service: very nice food for a reasonable price, very professional service. One thing to mention – down at the reception there were 4 tanks with water (all complimentary) – one had slices of lemon in it, another had slices of oranges, another one with melon, another one with grapefruit. Great idea – again something I could recommend for other hotels to introduce! Overall experience: pleasant and convenient for the stay during the conference. I would, however, not choose it for my vacation (I would prefer going to Coronado and stay at the beach..)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Very Unpleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: crazytrain07
Reviews.Content: I'm going to start off by saying I usually don't complain, but after the third problem I felt I just had to. Overall the hotel is a usual Westin and in a nice location. I always prefer paying a little extra for the Starwood experience knowing I'll get something nice and luxurious but this time that wasn't the case. It started at 4am. I was only in town one night but at 4am for some reason an alarm, or what sounded like an alarm, went off for about 30 seconds waking me from my sleep. I couldn't find the source and it wasn’t fire alarm loud, but way more than a simple phone or alarm clock alarm. Every 45 minutes or so this I’d hear this noise and it completely killed my sleep. The worst part is i couldn’t figure out what it was or where it was coming from. I admit I didn't call the front desk at that point because the noise was so intermittent and I really didn't want to change rooms at 5am. Finally after really getting up for the day I called to report the problem. The next problem was in the bathroom. The shower had hair from a pervious guest in it and so did the towels. I am usually understanding about these things, but it felt like insult to injury and was simply gross. I did tell the front desk person about both incidents and was comped breakfast/lunch but the only thing open was the bar. I was fine with that but the service at the bar was horrendous. It was a Sunday afternoon and there were probably 3 other parties there yet our service was terrible. Again, usually I love my westin experience and count on receiving it. That is why I'm willing to pay such a premium to stay there. However, based on this experience I could have received the same treatment for much much less. I'm not sure if I'll go back anytime soon but if I happen to, it will be after checking out plenty of other hotel chains.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: lsavino57
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Westin San Diego, and had a great experience from the minute we pulled up. The valet guys were more than accommodating, considering we kept leaving things in the car and they had to keep pulling it around, and were always friendly and pleasant. I called the morning of to see if they had our 2 rooms available for early checkin, and they gave us both room as early as we needed them and right near eachother. The lobby was nice and clean and looked new compared to other hotels I've stayed at. The rooms were great too! I had my pick of the 2 rooms and when we went to look at them both, I was pleased to find that they were different shapes and size, and not just the typical square shaped hotel room. The room was very clean and of course the Heavenly bed and bath were amazing. I plan on buying the Heavenly bed for myself at home! Overall I'm sure I will be staying at this hotel again. The location was good, only blocks away from Horton Plaza, and the price was better as well! Pool was not very exciting, but we weren't there to go swimming.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bar for a slow Sunday night”
Reviews.Author: Slick011
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the bar and the great food and service. It was a Sunday night and business was slow. The bartender (Sara Meadow) made some suggestions on the happy hour food and drinks which turn out great for my family and friends. We made the extra trip from the wedding party to have our drinks made down at the bar since the service was prompt and welcoming. I thank them all again for a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with convenient location near coast”
Reviews.Author: mdeofglss
Reviews.Content: Great hotel smack dab in downtown San Diego. It was pretty tricky to actually get to the hotel, as you have to make several out of the way turns on one way streets, but we called the hotel and got great directions. Our room was good, nothing exceptional, but what we would expect. There was usually only one person working at the front desk, but it never got too busy. Parking was pretty expensive ($21), which makes you feel like they are trying to squeeze every last penny out of you. Overall, a great value for what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel but Especially Great Concierge”
Reviews.Author: Roberval
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Westin San Diego for the first time in June 2010. We really appreciated the shuttle that took us from the airport to the hotel. We only waited 10 minutes before the shuttle showed up. On our way to the airport, the driver was polite but not really friendly. However, the concierge Sophie/Sophia was FANTASTIC. She helped us a lot and she was always smiling and not at all snobbish as the concierges usually are. However, we were shocked to learn that WIfi wasn't free. We are not used to paying for it. If there were one thing to change they shouldn't charge for the WIFI connections.

Reviews.Title: “As usual, oh what fun we had in your "heavenly bed" !!!!”
Reviews.Author: LesleyHadleyBarnes
Reviews.Content: Can't say too much except we had so much fun! Staff was great and the hotel is BEAUTIFUL. Within walking distance to EVERYTHING! THANKS.

Reviews.Title: “The Westin - consistantly great rooms, beds, service. Love the smell!”
Reviews.Author: bloth
Reviews.Content: I was traveling alone so it is great that the Westin offers consistent, quality accomodations . It's always a pleasure to stay at the Westin. Beds are so comfortable, rooms are quiet & beautiful, staff were friendly and helpful. And the white tea lotion, body wash, shampoo is one of my favorite scents.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice but disappointing”
Reviews.Author: sjv2010
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and the staff at the front desk was remarkable. We were a bit disappointed with a couple of things: #1 that you do not have free Wi-Fi access. We stayed at the Westin for 4 nights and elsewhere for 2 nights. At first, I thought maybe that just isn't something San Diego hotels offer. However, the other hotel we stayed at in San Diego as well as every hotel we stayed in on our way there and on our return home offered free Wi-Fi. So, it is very disappointing that a nice upscale hotel would not offer that. #2 it was also very disappointing you do not offer a free continental breakfast. Again, every other hotel we stayed in on this trip offered a free continental breakfast and I can't imagine that you guys don't offer it. #3 the parking situation is a mess. The valet employees were extremely nice and we adorerd them. However, I got conflicting information from them regarding parking. I felt like it is a hoax to only offer valet parking for $32 per day. Even in Canada, they gave us 2 different options for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: scottweber2
Reviews.Content: I wanted to write to commend the Westin San Diego Emerald Plaza and the outstanding service of housekeeper America E. and restaurant employee Juan Verduzco. These staff went above and beyond the call of service to provide outstanding assistance during my recent visit. Please thank them on my behalf. -- Scott Weber Pittsburgh, PA

Reviews.Title: “Best Location for a Conference Meeting”
Reviews.Author: CheriseBurdeen
Reviews.Content: I just completed a week-long stay at this hotel, because that's where we held our annual conference. The hotel was amazing, for sure, but what really stood out was the staff. As someone who has hosted several large conferences, it's the staff that matter. Rooms can be big and nice, food can be great, but if the staff are not attentive, professional, and give the impression they are on YOUR team (not the hotel's), the conference will sink. This last week, I spent time with Diane Nielson, Mark Reiter and Santiago from three different parts of the hotel staffing. Each (and others) were outstanding in their service to our business and conference guests. The most outstanding thing about this hotel is the fact that ANYONE who works at the hotel can be asked for ANYTHING and they will get it to you - doesn't matter if you're asking the banquet staff for something from security, the Front Desk staff for something from the AV department - not once did anyone utter that phrase all conference planners hate to hear: "sorry, that's not my department." I wish we could go back to this Westin San Diego for all our conferences.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, knowledgable staff”
Reviews.Author: valentinomj
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to San Diego. I was there for a conference. I was alone and the staff was so very nice to me in many respects. They had a shuttle to bring me to and from the airport at no charge. They gave me directions and maps to the trolley and the conference center, they helped me with places to eat and even helped me get to the zoo on the city bus!! The hotel was very nice with excellent beds and plenty of room. It was quiet and clean. I was very happy with my stay. The only drawback was, it is a far walk to the conference center but the trolley stop is right around the corner and it gets you there quickly for $5 all day pass.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific service at the Westin, 400 Broadway, San Diego”
Reviews.Author: PeterPoodle
Reviews.Content: Our recent visit to the Westin, 400 Broadway, San Diego was absolutely wonderful! Our room on the 22nd floor overlooked the Marina, Coronado Island, and the San Diego Bay. Our room was clean, modern, and bright with incredibly comfortable beds, sheets, and pillows. Falling to sleep with a view of the city lights was delightful. All the staff at the Westin were gracious, very polite and professional, and accommodating, giving us directions to all the many places we visited during our stay. When we arrived, we were welcomed by Stephen and his lovely colleague, a charming young lady from Croatia - a very warm reception after our exhausting trip was really appreciated. Trisha, our server at the Bar, made us feel very welcome, too, and suggested a tasty lunch from the restaurant menu to accompany our beverages. We enjoyed several meals at the 400 West restaurant in the hotel. Each day for breakfast, we were greeted by the hostess, Isabel Cortes and shown to our favorite table by the front windows. We couldn't resist the delicious Breakfast Buffet with Eggs Benedict, crispy bacon, yogurt, and a large selection of fresh fruits and muffins, and omelets "made-to-order". Our servers, Omar Corona, Juan, and all the entire restaurant staff were always friendly and helpful, ensuring that we had plenty of fresh hot coffee and orange juice. Thank you for a wonderful hotel experience. We look forward to our next visit to beautiful San Diego and the Westin!

Reviews.Title: “Fine Accomodations, Convenient Location, Gay Friendly”
Reviews.Author: nycger
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were at the Westin for a conference and a few days' vacation. Great room, comfortable bed, and nice gym with a good pool for laps for a hotel. Staff were very gay friendly. It is right near the first stop for the number 7 bus to Balboa Park, which is only about a 15-20 minute ride. Perfect even for coming home after evening performances at the Old Globe. They arranged a cheap car rental for the day so we could go up the coast (although the trolley goes there as well) and to Coronado Island (also easy by public transport but it's a big island). It's an easy walk to the sights downtown and the trolley to Old Town. It was our first visit to San Diego and we would go definitely go back. There are resort hotels right on the beach, if that is the objective of the visit, but for a place to stay to visit the sights, we couldn't have asked for better for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: HeatherFLondon
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal at the Westin through Hotwire and were pleasantly surprised at how nice the rooms were. The staff were all friendly and helpful. The hotel is only 5 minutes walk from the Coronado ferry and 10 minutes walk to the Gaslamp Quarter. The hotel has a nice pool area and a nice touch was the fruit flavoured water provided in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “First time trouble”
Reviews.Author: bswesq
Reviews.Content: When I got to my room there was a terrible smell of ammonia or some other cleaning substance. For the first time ever at any hotel I had to request a change of rooms. I wish I had immediately made the request as I stayed in the room for a litlte while hoping the smell would dissipate. Instead I got a headache. When I advised the front desk they were very courteous and sent someone up to the room with keys to a new room.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel with outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: patandgig
Reviews.Content: I am the president of the USS Caliente (A)-53) Association. We have been holding a reunion almost every year for the past 30 years. The Westin San Diego ranks in the top couple of hotels in which we have held our reunion. The room accommodations, the food and the attention to our group paid by the entire staff was outstanding. Everything I had agreed to prior to the reunion was executed without flaw. The meeting and banquet facilities were exceptional. Due to the attitude of the entire staff this was one of the best reunions we have had. Pat Hurton, President USS Caliente Association

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent”
Reviews.Author: nela101
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Westin was pleasent. The staff at both the bar and at the dining area were very attentive and friendly. My only other comment (which serves only to help you for future guests) is that the air conditioner in my room was very noisy and my phone did not work. I wanted to buy a robe from Westin which I really liked and the note on the hanger said to contact room services, since I had no phone, I went down to the front desk upon check-out and asked about purchasing a robe. The man at the front desk on the morning of 9/15/10, said he really did not have any information on how I could buy one and directed me to your website. Since I really wanted to buy a robe on location, this was disappointing to me. I think the front desk should be as informed and as accomodating to such requests as possible. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice high class hotel”
Reviews.Author: roloman
Reviews.Content: The room was very upscale and comfortable. The bed and shower were very nice. The breakfast buffet had a limited selection but was OK and the service was pleasant. Marites Sobreo my server was very friendly and pleasant. The valet parking is a little pricey $35 but they were always very quick to retrieve my car. Two of the attendants; brothers, Bennie and Berlon Sioson were very polite and helpful. In fact all the attendants always asked if I need help when I arrived and if I needed directions when I left. For me the location was ideal because it was close enough to the mall and Gaslamp district to walk but far enough so you are not kept up all night by the club music. Well worth the extra cost compared to the hotel I stayed at in the gaslamp quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, good service”
Reviews.Author: stevejose
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Westin San Diego. I enjoyed great service too. Kelly Norton was very friendly and gave great service.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: CarreraRob
Reviews.Content: I have stayed with Westin hotels many times over the years and this was my first stay in San Diego with you. Let me begin by saying that your staff upgraded our room to Bay View with no charge which was deeply appreciated. However, we stayed in room 2119 and the condition of the room was very disappointing. There was a large crack in the center of the sill of our window and the hot water tap poured water from under the handle every time you turned on the water. (It soaked some of our travel items completely before we noticed the leak. The room showed much wear and took away from the romantic feel I had hoped for with my wife. We were also very disappointed that your valet charge was $32.00 PER NIGHT which we thought was more than excessive. Your staff was, as always, polite but the hotel was certainly not what I have come to expect from a Westin. Won't stay there again and hope that you will consider better upkeep of your rooms in San Diego if you want patrons to return. No offense intended but the warm place I hold Westin Hotels has diminished. Thanks for hearing me out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Ambience”
Reviews.Author: NYGOIL
Reviews.Content: Had a great time over Labor Day weekend at the Westin San Diego. The customer service was great and everyone was very helpful. A special Thank YOU to waiter Juan Verduzco Jr who worked in the restaurant during the breakfast period. Also, another very sincere Thank YOU to the Shuttle Bus driver 'Andres.' He brought a special charm to some weary travelers and changed a negative "wait time" at the Airport into a positive. Also both of them gave us invaluable information regarding the City of San Diego and it's layout, along w/the festivities over the Labor Day Weekend. Thanks guys! ---Clarence & Pauline Hutchens :)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous,fun,fantastic and simply refreshing.”
Reviews.Author: AutumnTununak
Reviews.Content: The service I received was excellent. The rooms were nice and spacey. The location and amenities were comfortable. I liked the service I received and I cant say that I did not have anything that I did not like.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sheridan_10
Reviews.Content: I was a bit apprehensive about being away from the main part of the city, but found that it was literally a 10 minute walk if that from all of the restaurants. The staff was really friendly and the rooms were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Marianne9256
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay tremendously! The hotel room was so comfortable and luxurious - the bedding is everyything they describe and better. We stayed for 5 nights and Griselda kept our room immmaculate and worked with our schedule. We loved the work out facility and the location of the hotel. Very easy walk to lots of great restaurants, the trolley and Seaport Village, and, of course, Horton Plaza for shopping!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Close to everything in San Diego.”
Reviews.Author: tmcnally01
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and close to everything in San Diego. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful in navigating the San Diego area. Buffet breakfast was fabulous. Rooms were spacious and clean.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time. Everyone was...”
Reviews.Author: avalvear
Reviews.Content: We had a great time. Everyone was helpful and friendly. Berlon, our bellhop, helped us when we arrived and checked out. He made sure the kids had their kid pack and was playful with the kids. Thank you Westin for a fun weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Zuloma Lopez, Exceptional hostess/servers helper”
Reviews.Author: marySeguin
Reviews.Content: Zuloma Lopez is an exceptional hostess. Extremely helpful and friendly and a great memory of the guest.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Oldnslo
Reviews.Content: The staff was wonderful. Especially Sergio Guerra who brought breakfast each morning. On time, as requested, and with such good cheer you could not help starting your day with a smile. Promote this guy, let him run the hote, but don't let him go!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't forget to visit the great restaurant at the hotel for breakfast or brunch”
Reviews.Author: RaiderHater
Reviews.Content: I tried the restaurant at the Westin San Diego for their breakfast buffet after hearing a recommendation from a local San Diegan and left fat and happy! Our server Kelly was great, very attentive and kept my coffee hot and full. She suggested I try the cheese omelet and it was a fantastic choice! My friend had the waffle and loved it. Juan was very fast and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Great service from Juan Verduzco at the Westin - San Diego”
Reviews.Author: gmontoya
Reviews.Content: I attended a business lunch in the hotel on August of 2010. The location was easy to access and clean. The staff was pleasingly attentive… it seemed to come natural for Juan Verduzco. I can’t tell you how important I believe this is to a customers overall satisfaction... nothing speaks louder (in my experience) than pure performance/execution. Regards, George

Reviews.Title: “Perfect everything stay!”
Reviews.Author: TreatsAz
Reviews.Content: My best friend & I stayed four nights, two beds, water view room. 1st impression was fantastic - beautiful entrance & exceptional staff. Secondly, the guest room was gorgeous - EVERYTHING about it. The linens and bed were the best. Room service selection great, restaurant and lovely bar area and hostess and business center all perfect. The whole concept of hotel/office building makes for a vibrant, visually pleasing hotel lobby environment. A perfect stay with spacious guest room (even with two beds) - everything updated, even the bathroom! An A+ from someone in hospitality over 20 years!

Reviews.Title: “stay at this westin”
Reviews.Author: LiveLaughLove64
Reviews.Content: My girls and I loved our vacation to San Diego. All of the staff at the Westin were laid-back and helpful. We felt safe and truly relaxed. In particular, we would like to thank and recognize our server in the breakfast buffet, Juan. He was prompt and was able to cater to the special dietary needs of my 13 year old daughter. Thanks again and we will return next August!! arlene, kelly and alison bulanski

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: zebramussel188560
Reviews.Content: We experienced a relaxed friendly atmosphere of all staff members including those in the restaurant where we were served by Mrs. Marites Sobreo

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel service”
Reviews.Author: chewitt49
Reviews.Content: The Westin San Diego offers a high quality experience with friendly staff who have gone out of their way to make our stay delightful. Our son turned two while we were here and the staff have been more than happy to engage with him. In the restaurant, the hostess, Zulema Lopez, has become one of his friends that he greets each morning. A family friendly hotel for all.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: lmscanlon
Reviews.Content: We were in San Diego to visit our son in the US Navy. The Hotel was everything we wanted and expected on arrival. Staff was most helpful and courtious. We asked for a refrigerator for medicine and it was delivered to the room immediately. The hotel is centrally located and ideal for using the SD transit system, which was very easy to use. We definitely did not feel the need for a rental car, $36. per night to park at the hotel. There is no free WiFi, however cafe downstairs in same building offers free WiFi. Would absolutely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “SPECTACULAR!!!”
Reviews.Author: surfnsnow32
Reviews.Content: I took my wife for a little romantic staycation (we are from San Diego) / anniversary, and I was blown away by the service and dedication of everyone that worked there. Molly especially, at the conciege, was AMAZING!!! She not only helped get a great room with a wonderful view, but also arrainnged for chocolate covered strawberries and champagne on ice to be waiting for my wife as she entered the room. Molly helped make the weekend unforgettable, and I truely thank her for everything. We will definitely be coming back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Da Bomb!”
Reviews.Author: jamesnp
Reviews.Content: Since it was going to be too hot this week - I took my mother to the Westin at The Emerald Plaza! The beds - were "Heavenly! The Showers; Heavenly! The room - looking over the bay = Priceless! We were close to all transportation. We had fine servers: There was Melissa in the Bar! Excellent! There was Martes in the Restaurant! Excellent! There was Andreas at the Bell Station! Again, Excellent! Each and Every one made our stay memorable!!!! After check-out, I noticed that I was billed for a movie - Steve in Billing took it off my bill! Excellent! Even the Manager, Luke, took time from all of the check in duties to make a welcome! I stay in places all around the country - this is by far the best hotel I've ever stayed! If I could register a complaint - - - There is no note paper in the room... I couldn't write a thank you to the staff! They know the area! They were ready to recommend competition! They were eager to make our stay enjoyable at any opportunity! They were consummate professionals! Lastly - During the daylight hours - they have this beautiful water bar... It has the essence of: Melon, Orange, Lemon and Grapefruit! When you are traveling - whatever the reason - when you get to your "home" - You want a drink of water - this is ultimate luxury! It's like diving into a scented pool! Very Refreshing!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed we expected better”
Reviews.Author: skynef
Reviews.Content: The room we received was adequate in size and space. We travel to San Diego on business regularly. The next morning we went to breakfast. The time was 9:45 A.M. Along with our stay we were to receive a free breakfast. In the restaurant, No One greeted us. Finally, we took it on our own to be seated. Ten minutes later a service person, not the waiter, spoke to us about the buffet. Let me summarize, the food was cold, the service was lousy, and no one came to talk to us about the situation. The staff was moving about but seemed more interested in setting up for lunch. We were in plain sight. We tried on two occasions to speak to people regarding this matter. The best we heard was "sorry". This was the same comment we heard from the front desk when checking out of the hotel. We paid for a room and free breakfast. The reason for these comments, is that every business needs the feedback of their customers in order to make adjustments to improve. Although I am not a business as large as the airlines whose personnel stay at your hotel, I do frequent San Diego. Employees need to have a place to rest, refresh, and get on with the day. How could I recommend your hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Great overall Westin Experience”
Reviews.Author: sh2349
Reviews.Content: As a Platinum Starwood elite, I've stayed in my fair share of Starwood branded hotels, and this one is pretty good! The front desk staff very accomodating and friendly. The staff at the 400 West Restaurant at the hotel, particularly my waitress Lindsay H. who made sure my leisurely breakfast with laptop and newspaper at the restaurant went with every request filled. Definitely would go back.

Reviews.Title: “My waiter was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: TravelsOftenMaricopa
Reviews.Content: My waiter Teresa at the Hotel restaurant was absolutelly amazing. I travel weekly to different destinations across the United States and she was the best I have seen in 5 years of travel. She went out of her way to be sure I understood the different menu options and checked on me regularly. She also noticed that I was in "work mode" and asked if I would like to take coffee with me as I left. This would not be a normal thing to consider at the dinner hour but she noticed! Just perfect attention to her customers needs! Thank you for hiring such great people!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous weather & poolside with sweet people in a business needing improvements.”
Reviews.Author: MLJCoachingIntrntnl
Reviews.Content: As I say the weather (over which you have no control) was idyllic. The poolside (over which you do have control) was lovely! Did I not find a phone by the pool? I had to trapse around inside the hallways looking for one, and did finally find one to order a salad, which was delicious. The coffee creamers in the rooms is poison. How can you honestly offer that to guests? When I looked out my window to gaze at the ocean ... I could barely see out the window due to the thick dirt on it. That wasn't just an accumulation since your spring clean. For your future guests, THANK YOU FOR HIRING SOME WINDOW CLEANERS! I ordered coffee and in the time it took me to go up the escalator to the conference room it was STONE cold! Both the one with cream and the one for my friend which was black. They removed the charge, but no offer was made to deliver HOT coffee to me when it was available ... and I had at that point used up my entire break getting the coffee. I used my robe the first night and likely left it on the bed or maybe the floor. It was taken out of the room but not replaced, so receiving room service the 2nd evening I had no robe to put on. Frustrating. Your people, however, are all very friendly and super helpful. It would, really, take very little to focus in on these items. As a business success coach, www.mljcoaching.com I wish you continued success. Lynne P.S. I would recommend this hotel to a friend, but I would warn them that it's over-priced for the quality (ie. the items I've mentioned).

Reviews.Title: “The quintessential customer service”
Reviews.Author: DrGray
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of eating 400 West restaurant in the Westin, every person I encountered in the restaurant and bar was exceptional. I was first met by a server in the bar area named Tricia Littlefield, her service was so exceptional I thought she would be an anomaly but I later found out was a common theme among everyone I encounter in food services. WOW!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “HAPPY WE STAYED!!! GOOD CHOICE!”
Reviews.Author: xp14505
Reviews.Content: I recently Stayed at the Westin (Visiting Family) for 2nights & wish we could of stayed longer! The staff was very nice and extremely efficient. Great hospitality and very accommodating. The Hotels Administration is Top Notch!!! Jose Ramos Supervisor of The Westin; has such a professional and well trained staff, I was pretty amazed! Loved the Bar and Restaurant. Great Choice if you plan to stay in Sandiego & Great Location :)

Reviews.Title: “adequate-not Westin quality”
Reviews.Author: bpbeth
Reviews.Content: Travelling the US on a weekly basis, I see it all and have established standards for value. When dropped off at the hotel by a taxi, I was not greeted by the hotel employees standing outside even tho I had 4 bags, was not offered help until I had wrestled the bags into the hotel myself. that is expected at a Motel 8, not at a Westin. the front desk associate was pleasant, told me I had boxes delivered for the conference, which could be delivered to the conference area when needed. The day the boxes were requested, they could not be located for hours. The room was small, the bathroom poorly lit, especially for a female traveller, the room was not organized for business or leisure. Why have a desk situated away from the large flat screen, or why have a large flat screen? The king room was set up for a single traveller who planned no time in the room. This hotel was located next to an office complex which I am sure populates the hotel with out concerning the hotel to raise it's standards. Food service was fair, the coffee was horrible in the restaurant, banquet services and even the so called Starbucks in the lobby. the iced tea was worse. One evening banquet had a decent entrée. If the conference is held at the same location again, I will find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Six Gun
Reviews.Content: Within walking distance of Seaport Village and Gaslamp District, shops and restaurants, also trolley service.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and great service”
Reviews.Author: annhuaa
Reviews.Content: Great staffs at the front desk. The room is clean and the view is beautiful.It is a great stay for me because the staffs at hotel are so friendly and welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Accomodations and staff are excellent.”
Reviews.Author: rusthound
Reviews.Content: The entire staff is professional and very accommodating. We arrived a day early for a family vacation and were greeted with warm smiles. Luke at the Front desk was able to help with special requests. We ate breakfast at the hotel everyday where Zulema Lopez made us feel like we were at home. Service was excellent from everyone in the restraunt including Kelly Norton and Lindsey Hoeho, they responded delightlyfully to any request.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of an excellent conference!!”
Reviews.Author: WCMID
Reviews.Content: We are holding our 11th annual conference at the Westin San Diego right now and I am super impressed with the hotel and the service provided here. Our Convention Service Manager, Paul Lotz, has gone above and beyond to make sure that we are taken care of. He has taken the time to meet with me personally before our conference, to walk through our space with any questions I have and to make sure I was well taken care of from the moment I checked in. He has personally introduced me to all the staff that has taken care of our group and has been checking in frequently, and being wonderful ith last minute changes. Our banquet manager, Baron Meyer, has been overseeing all the details and making sure all of the set up is done, the food is delivered on time and that the program run smoothly. He has been great in making sure all of our needs are met and that everything is as requested. Scott Gross, Direrctor of F&B, has been extremely hands on with our program and has a overseen the menu to make sure our food is fresh and delicious. The food we have had is some of the best we have ever eaten at a hotel. Lastly, Ray Nicolas, the AV manager has worked very hard to make sure our general session and all of our breakout A/V needs are met. He has worked in conjunction with our trade show decorator to fulfill the needs of our strategic partners. Overall, I am extremely happy with the service we have been provided with so far and am ready to rebook for next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & always well taken care of!”
Reviews.Author: me774
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times & must say I am always treated so well by the front desk and hotel staff. Everyone always has a friendly can do attitude. Each room is a different shape due to the way the building is laid out, so some rooms are definitely better than others. It is a little further from the "action" of the Gaslamp Quarter than the other Westin but is much more convenient for transit and the bay sightseeing. Many rooms have a bay view too which is awesome! My favorite part is going to the hotel bar after a long day. The bartender Melissa is always friendly and makes an amazing Manhattan!

Reviews.Title: “The people who served me were excellent and professional.”
Reviews.Author: BrainyTopanga
Reviews.Content: Service was prompt and "above and beyond the call of duty."

Reviews.Title: “the people make the place!”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTraveller520
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good but what really made the place was the people. Everyone I met on staff was knowledgeable and helpful. Molly Moran, the conceriege, was particularly outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Just a good room”
Reviews.Author: rteixeir
Reviews.Content: The room was ok and clean. I was sorprise for the lack of hospitality from all the hotel team. From checking where they were very cold to never been welcome by the doorbell when we arrive. I really expected more from a Westin hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: humbrd88
Reviews.Content: We came for my nephews wedding and when we arrived, our rooms are not availabe. We had a party of 3 and needed 2 double beds. I booked 3 weeks ahead and confirmed each time about my arrival time. The desk person said they only made a notation, but didn't block off the room. She gave us two rooms and then moved one into the other with a roll away for the next night. Didn't offer anything else. I had to ask next morning if they would at least comp the valet. Room was small, no door to the bathroom except for the toilet and shower. So in a room of 3, that was not convenient in anyway. The makeup mirror was missing a screw, so it won't stay in place. The bath faucet was leaking and the hot/cold indicator is totally backwards. You thought you are turning to hot, but it was freezing cold water. The Room phone cordless handset didn't work, so we couldn't figure out how to call valet or front desk. Later, we found out it's because the cordless phone has the same frequency as the internet, so it doesn't work. Why put that phone in there then? We also hear the same thing with other guests that was attending the wedding. Couldn't find reservations, the room have things that don't work. There were no place to really have lunch. We had to sit outside. All said, this was a bad hotel and now each time we see a Westin, we don't think we will stay at one anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding accomodations”
Reviews.Author: shooter57
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with almost all aspects of the hotel. The biggest frustration was with the parking, Valet was $32/night and self park (not being hosted by the hotel) was $24 and did not give you in/out privileges. Breakfast was included in our rate, and was fantastic. Walking distance to the Gaslamp.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay and good service”
Reviews.Author: Omib
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay, and we loved your Breakfast Buffet. The Service was good and we would like to give a special thank you to Kelly Norton she is an excellent Server.She waited on us several times at breakfast and Lunch. She deserves a pad on the back. Thank you Elfie Wilson and Family

Reviews.Title: “What an Amazing group of people!!!”
Reviews.Author: THoel
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Westin was outstanding! The staff here at the Westin downtown San Diego was Incredible. Each day it was obvious the staff enjoyed their jobs and enjoyed making the customers smile. You don't find this too often and I wanted to share it with others who may consider staying here. They went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable with little effort. I would recommend this hotel to anyone! We were in SD to get married and stayed at the Westin as well as many of our guests. By far the best staff I have had the pleasure of working with!! A BIG Thank you to Scott, Jose, Lindsey, Ashley and Melissa! We look forward to staying here on our one year anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Wow turn an office building into a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Trigger89
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right downtown. Very close to the water front. Great views of the city. Very close to sea world. I want to thank Jessi the bellman he is Great. He took very good care of us. We checked in late after a long drive. He gave us the lay out of the hotel. The hours of the outlets. I also want to Thank Kelly Norton in restaurant. She is so nice and always made sure we had everything we needed while dining there.

Reviews.Title: “The weather was cold but the Hotel staff was warm and helpful.”
Reviews.Author: Matthirsch
Reviews.Content: I just want to acknowledge a couple staff members of your hotel. Lyndsay that served us brunch every morning was fantastic!! We had brunch there several times and always remembered our names and what we wanted specifically for breakfast every morning. She even gave us advice on what beaches to visit during our stay. Lyndsay always had a smile on her face and treated us like she knew us for years. I also want to thank Andre at the bell desk. Andre gave us great introduction of the hotel upon check in. He even offered to get information about the Padre's game times while we were in town. When we would encounter Andre during our stay he would always greet us and ask us how we were doing. Best, Matt Hirschfeld

Reviews.Title: “Very Memorable 1st Family Trip”
Reviews.Author: Changa22
Reviews.Content: Kelly and Omar from the restaurant were both very attentive and provided my family and I with excellent service. Omar was very friendly and he was able to direct us to our vacations spots such as Sea World and accomodate my family and I with our basic needs.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: West-Coast-Fan
Reviews.Content: This Westin property is a pretty nice hotel. The staff is very friendly, the hotel is modern and the location is good. My room was very clean but did seem a little dated. My room had a couple of issues. The bathroom towel bar was coming off the wall and a light fixture was broken, actually exposing some wiring. I reported both to the front desk. A maintenance person tried to fix the light but it was still dangerous. The right response should have been to either properly fix the light or move me to another room, which they didn't do. I'll give them the benefit of the doubt because Westin is normally better than that. Valet parking is steep, $32 a day. Self parking is available for a little less but you lose in and out privileges. Do yourself a favor and go the valet parking route. The pool was a little small but nice. Overall, I liked this Westin. It is suited for business or family travel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in beautiful city”
