Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin for 3 nights in April 2009, while in San Diego for a conference. I was fortunate to obtain a (still expensive) discounted rate and free internet access through my conference. Free airport shuttle, convenient location near the Gaslamp Quarter, the conference center and Little Italy. My room was beautifully appointed, with the famous Westin bed, an enormous bathroom, and a luxurious bathrobe. The hotel has a fantastic gym that is open 24 hrs./day, and I was quite impressed by the friendliness of the staff members. Two mornings, for example, the shuttle bus driver was nice enough to drive me to the conference center (a pleasant 15-min. walk away, but problematic when in heels and/or carrying luggage). I would highly recommend this hotel -- I really enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “the best wedding every”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkCitySasha
Reviews.Content: this hotel is very nice the poeple the hotel itself is nice i would come back and bring friends too .

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely an amazing place for a wedding”
Reviews.Author: cdhsaved
Reviews.Content: Great location and access to public transportation, restaurants, entertainment, shopping sightseeing and freeways. The room was spacious and the bed was very comfortable; slept like a baby! The food was very advertising and delicious. The check in and check out were fast and smooth.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chachi07
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the Westin on our way to Palm Springs. The hotel is nice, heavenly bed and bathroom. However, the hotel is starting to show its age. The decor could use a makeover. Staff was friendly but not overly attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: nbologne
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin San Diego in August 2007 for a week. The room was great - clean, modern, extremely comfortable bed. I thought the location was good as well - walking distance to shopping, restaurants, and the convention centre. Had room service one night for dinner and it was excellent. The fitness centre was great. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Only hotel in San Diego I will stay”
Reviews.Author: ProjectManager42
Reviews.Content: If you have the pleasure of going to San Diego - you have to stay at the Westin San Diego. Not only is the location central to everything (Gaslamp, Harbor, Seaport Village, and Little Italy) but it is pet friendly. The area around the hotel is clean and it doesn't seem to have nearly as many homeless people around, as the ones closer to the Gaslamp area. The staff is extremely knowledgeable and they treat me and my dogs like we are VIP's. The hotel has a great feel to it and the rooms are very clean. #1 place to stay in SD in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Good, solid hotel - just not an impressive one.”
Reviews.Author: jasper87
Reviews.Content: This hotel is solid - they provide the basics just as they should. However, its just missing that "wow" factor to make it an impressive one. The rooms were clean, maid service was timely and everything in my room was functional. The staff, while efficient, just didn't have that "pop" to make it a great property. While they weren't rude, it felt like they were just going through the motions to provide check-in/check-out service to us. We called for an airport shuttle and were told it would take 20 minutes. It took 40. We arrive and the desk clerk checked us in, but it took 15 minutes for two rooms. The only noticeable exception - the conceriege when he was at his post. He knew the area extremely well and guided us to perfect restaurants and shopping. However, we tried to visit him six times - only two times was he at his post. Overall, a solid, well-functioning hotel. Just not one that will stand out in our minds.

Reviews.Title: “Fine downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: eckythump
Reviews.Content: A belated review after staying here in late May 2008 for 4 nights. Good location in downtown San Diego, It's a 10 minute walk to the Gaslamp District and 5-10 to the waterfront. Very short walk to Santa Fe railway station which we used for travelling on to Los Angeles. Hotel has its own airport pick up service which we didn't know about, but it only cost $10 by taxi anyway (I love how close San Diego airport is to downtown). Check-in was quick and easy, staff pleasant without being overly enthusiastic. Was assigned a room on one of the lower levels with a view of Broadway. Quite an odd shaped room (looking at the fire plan on the back of the door the rooms seemed to vary widely in size and shape). This was the first time we'd stayed in a Westin and their heavenly bed and shower lived up to the hype - the king bed was one of the most comfortable i've ever experienced, as was the shower, they should be banned because i was wasting water, i just didn't want to get out! Nice large flat screen tv with HD channels (local plus ESPN, HBO etc). External noise was an issue - could hear buses and trucks go past on Broadway, though that was tolerable, the worst came in the middle of the night, when goods trains would blast their horn continuously (presumably as they went over the crossing), it wasn't just a short sharp blast, it went on an on and on. This probably happened for 10-20 minutes each night we were there and made for quite a disrupted sleep. At least it wasn't the whole night i guess. DId not eat in the hotel or use the pool so i can't comment on those. The location may not suit everyone. Outside of the Gaslamp Quarter downtown San Diego is rather quiet at night and a lot of homeless people congregate on Broadway (the Greyhound station is not far away from the hotel). Still we did plenty of walking (including walking back from Petco Park after taking in a Padres game) and did not feel unsafe at any time. We stayed in the Sofia Hotel about 7 months prior to this, and the Westin was definitely the better of the 2 - much larger rooms and doesn't have the paper thin wall problem the Sofia does. I can understand why other people have commented it is a little dull and lifeless as it is clearly a business hotel first and a holiday hotel second, but if you want a party hotel then go and stay at the Hard Rock Hotel. The Westin was fine for our needs, featured the best bed and shower we've ever experienced and was extremely comfortable. What more can you want?

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: AATBenjamin
Reviews.Content: This wasn't a bad Westin, it just wasn't a great Westin. The lobby was kind of funky. It felt like an office building more than a Starwood hotel. The room was comfotable, but the shape was a little odd. The bar/restaurant downstairs was also a bit strange. I went down for a drink and a late dinner and was the only one there. Me and the bartender watching sportscenter. The location would be good if you wanted to spend time downtown, venture into the gaslamp district or just be near the airport. Not great if you're going to SD for some beach time. Again it there wasn't anything about it that was bad. It just didn't wow me.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure if I would go back...”
Reviews.Author: Pemaca
Reviews.Content: I cannot decide if I liked the hotel or not. It definitely is clean and the service was what I expected. But here is a list of my issues. 1. Booked a room with two double beds and requested a rollaway which was printed on my confirmation. Upgraded for $25 to bayview. At check in was told that rollaways were not permitted due to fire codes. Impossible for me and two teen boys to fit in the room we were given. Even though it was an upgrade, the room was so small, you could not walk around the beds, there was no door to the bathroom that you could close, only a pocket door that did not close. Windows were covered up in places with yellow tape, as if they were broken. Upon seeing the size of the room and the unavailability of the rollaway, I had to book another room. Funny thing is - in booking the new room - I got the cheapest room available at the time and it was much larger and nicer than the original room I booked (so my issue with the hotel, is what is the point of an upgraded room, what exactly did my upgrade pay for)...! By the way the cheaper room also had a bayview. Another point of contention, my friends stayed in a lower rate room and not only had more space, a bayview and a real bathroom door, but also received bathrobes, which I did not get). My suggestion is do not get the upgrade!! Another point of contention is the location. I think it is convenient in the sense that you can walk to just about anywhere you need to go, but I would not feel comfortable at night in that area, definitely as a woman with kids felt like I had to be hyper aware. I am used to the homeless, living and working in Boston, but the hotel seems to be in a very active homeless area. There is a lot of people asking for money, so just know this if you are going to stay here. I did like the pool and hot tub, but other than that, I don't think I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “loved it...don't know why anyone would complain...”
Reviews.Author: freckles101
Reviews.Content: Went to this hotel with my boyfriend, and as soon as i walked in i was stunned...the lobby was beautiful and the elavators were glass and see threw. I loved the outside pool which was on the 3rd floor and loved the view of the beauiful downtown San Diego. The place was very clean and spotless.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in downtown san diego”
Reviews.Author: travelswithmykids
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin San Diego this summer for almost ten days, with my three children (2, 5 and 7 years old).....Needless to say, being on my own with the three of them, I had my hands full! But everything was perfect and much easier than I had anticipated, thanks to the great location and wonderful staff!! We walked everywhere, loved being able to see the "pirate ships" from our window, had room service every night (with a lovely waitress who took fabulous care of us!!), and sometimes breakfast downstairs where they have magic slates as kid menus (my kids loved that, and I had a great breakfast while they played). Andrew the concierge had wonderful advice on where to go and how to get there, while my kids had a drink of water flavoured with fresh fruit (fountains located just next to the concierge desk, kept them entertained) We loved the Zoo, the pirate ships, Lego land, Sea world, the USS midway, taking the old trolley to Coronado island for a day at the beach, having lunch or dinner in the Gaslamp or Italian quarter (both great !) After our day, we always went to the pool that is a bit small but just fine for my kids and I, and then relaxed in our connecting rooms, which was great because it gave the kids some leg room and afforded me some quiet time in the evenings...

Reviews.Title: “A Little Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Melbourne4_8
Reviews.Content: After reading lots of reviews we stayed at The Westin for 4 nights in September. We were picked up from the airport by the free shuttle, which was very convenient. Check in was smooth and I did ask for a large rom, however the girl insisted all room sizes were the same. I am not sure if they are or not but it didn't really matter as we were there to sightsee and wouldn't be spending a huge amount of time in the rooms. We had a couple of problems with the safe and a problem in the bathroom, but these were resolved promptly. The beds were comfy but the decor was quite dated. I noticed that the powerpoints in the hallway were falling off ,which isn't ideal if you have small children around. Everyone raves about the shower, but I couldn't really see what all the fuss is about. It was an average bathroom. One strange thing was that housekeeping kept leaving clean towels but never took the dirty ones. By the end of the stay we had quite a collection of towels!! The hotel was centrally located to the train depot, the wharf and within walking distance to Little Italy. Wehad no problems getting around without a car which was why we chose a central location. There seemed to be quite a few homeless people around the hotel. There were more homeless people than I anticipated. I was usually with a group when walking back to the hotel from dinner so didn't feel afraid. However, on one occasion when I had to walk back to the hotel alone someone tried to follow me. I did feel a little threatened as it was quite a few blocks to walk from the main shopping area and not alot of places to get help if needed. The Westin was pricey for what it offered although I did get a reasonable deal from Expedia. Would I choose this hotel again. Probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: ElyseAshton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin San Diego for three days to attend the San Diego film festival. The location was great and we could easily walk to all the venues. The train depot is nearby and the highway entrance/exit is less than a mile away so it makes getting around the San Diego area very simple. The hotel itself was very clean, felt freshly decorated and comfortable. The room was spacious and everything worked properly. The bed is enormous and we slept very well. There were two 'comfy chairs" of different styles. We got some noise from the train depot and the ships coming into the harbor, but nothing to inhibit rest. The staff anticipated us running out of shampoo, etc, and left more when they saw we were running low. On my birthday, I came back to the room to find they had set my birthday card from my husband( --which I had just opened that morning )on the bed and surrounded it with chocolates! We attended parties for the festival at different venues and met up with groups staying at the nearby W hotel, and both my husband and I agreed we preferred the Westin for comfort and serenity . Our room overlooked the bay and we could watch the sailboats and cruise ships come in. It is well worth a little extra to us to get that sort of water view. All the employees from the front desk to the valets, housekeeping and restaurant staff, were friendly and helpful. Every single one. They gave us directions and answered questions. No attitude or rush. What a refreshing change after a recent stay at a factory-feeling hotel in Vegas! The breakfast buffet at the restaurant is a little expensive ($18--for me who usually stumbles around at home in the morning with tea and toast) but has a great selection of fruits, yogurts, breads and hot dishes. You can also order a la carte off the menu and there is a coffee shop in the lobby so you can just grab a quick bite. My only caveat would be that despite the convenience of the location, some people might not enjoy the area as there are many homeless who may approach--and did ---even just inside the hotel doors one evening. There is a Greyhound bus station a couple of blocks away and the people you meet on your walks can seem a bit dodgey. I'm from LA and used to that, but I know my family from Wisconsin would be uncomfortable. Area parking is also expensive but worth it to keep one's car safely indoors under guard. Again, coming from LA I find it is a false economy not to pay for parking in a downtown area. We had a lovely time at the Westin and could easily recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but a little bland”
Reviews.Author: Onmessage1
Reviews.Content: You know what? Westin did the best it could with this one. The Westin San Diego shares its lobby with an office complex, Emerald Plaza, and it's hard to see where one starts and one stops. (As a result, you sometimes feel like you're standing in an office rather than a hotel lobby.) That said, the rooms have been freshly redecorated and are nice in that Westin monochromatic way. The beds, of course, are great as is the shower! There is also a fantastic fitness facility and lap pool. The hotel location has its plusses and minusses. On the plus side, it's close to little Italy, the waterfront and to Horton Plaza. In addition, you don't hear the trains much at all, which is a real issue downtown. On the minus side, the hotel is directly across the street from the YMCA and there always seemed to be quite a few homeless out in front.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: TorontoBachelor
Reviews.Content: We had absolutely no complaints with the Westin San Diego, and our trip was perfect in every aspect. The Valet guys were prompt and our car was always there by the time we got down the elevator. The location was prime (only 5 min walk from Gaslamp district and the heart of the city) and in the other direction a stone's throw away from the harbor. I would definately recommend the Westin to anyone visiting San Diego!!

Reviews.Title: “Will Try Somthing Different Next Time”
Reviews.Author: EverettDickens
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in June 2008. Staying here again would certainly not be the worst thing, there are definately some niceties, but the little things started to add up enough that next time we go to San Diego we will very likely try another hotel as this Westin did not "sell us." The good: 1) We asked for a high floor and received a room on the 20th floor. 2) Great view of the water and sunset. 3) Great shower. 4) Convenient location (close to a brewery; Gaslamp Quarter; Petco Park; WAMU ATM; bagel shop; Seaport Village etc.). 5) Staff was very friendly, helpful and accessible (but not always successful). The not-so-good: 1) The air conditioning either didn't work the first night or has such a high setting of temperature to be useless. The next day we asked for both the air conditioning to be looked at and for a good old fashioned fan. We were advised both would be handled within a short time. When we came back to the room several hours later, there was a note that the air conditioning was fixed, but there was no difference from what we could tell. Also, there was no fan. I called downstairs to the front desk and asked again for the fan; was told again a fan would be delivered to our room; but no fan was ever delivered to us as promised. The bed was very comfy, but because the room was stuffy we got little sleep. 2) We left the room around 10 a.m. the 2nd day we stayed, and when we arrived back around, ballpark, 5 or 6, no housekeeping had been done (we're pretty low-maintenance, but were expecting at least clean towels and the bed made so called down for towels and TP and let the rest be as was). 3) Couple small things: Would be nice if there was a phone book and a TV listing guide in the room as there was neither and... 4) There's no place in the bathroom to hang a wet towel. 5) The day we left, I went downstairs to print out our boarding passes. First, I was unable to access the door with my room card as it indicated to do, so I went to the front desk to get assistance. She also had trouble till she realized they decided not to lock the door any longer so you really didn't need a key (although it did not indicate this on the door but rather the opposite). When I tried to print the pass, there was no paper in any of the 8 drawers of printers or copy machine. Back I went to the front desk where they had to call an engineer for paper as that dept. was the only one who was allowed to load paper. Went back to the front desk about 15 minutes later. They called Engineering again. Engineering was there in about 5 minutes after the 2nd call, but he only loaded paper into 2 printer drawers so I did let them know the copier & other printers were out as well (to hopefully avoid frustration for both engineering and customers later that day). Ultimately, the Jet Blue site would not print out the pass after all my repearted attempts (it was asking for some kind of code for that particular computer that was not supplied or I didn't figure out) so the whole process proved a frustration. 6) I filled out a review card at the hotel before I left AND also an online form sent to me a couple weeks later. I have, as of yet, NEVER received any comment from the hotel regarding some of the frustrations we experienced (it is now 7/27/08 - almost 2 months later - I waited to see if they would send me some consolation - even just a few words - but nothing).

Reviews.Title: “Good example of a Westin”
Reviews.Author: AstroJunq
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great downtown location, a beautiful lobby, very nice rooms and pleasant staff. It was certainly above average, but a little short of excellent, though. Major issue: Simply put, the internet service sucked. At the lobby it's free, but it's soooooo slow that make you want to scream. You're better off crossing the street to a Starbucks or something. In the room, it's even worse, it keeps dropping and refusing to connect again. Oh, and you're paying top dollar for it! The service was so bad that in the end the hotel actually didn't charge me. I hope people soon realize tha free wi-fi should be a standard service for any 4 or 5 star hotel. Stop nickel and diming... Minor issue 1: The TV was pretty nice and it was the only hotel I've been with HD. Wow! Problems was, due to the way they setup the room, the TV was so far away from the bed that I could hardly see what was going on, it was like trying to watch a 10' TV. It had so much potential... Minor Issue 2: The restaurant was, at best, ok. The food wasn't bad and the service was pleasant, but the menu has like 5 item on it Really? Yep, they couldn't offer much, it was either this, that or the other. A little more freedom of choice wouldn't hurt... Overall, the good things far outweight the bad, so I'd definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Staying in town for a change”
Reviews.Author: padrefans
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay in town to get away from the norm and catch a padre game. The westin was perfect. The room was great and our concierge gave us the perfect trip through the gaslamp, hitting a bunch of the infamous bars on our way to the game. It was only a two stop trip on the trolley back and the bar in the huge atrium lounge was still open for a great end to our night. It was a perfect way to get away only miles from home and we are already planning our next stay at the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown San Diego Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nannel
Reviews.Content: The Westin San Diego is a great hotel for a downtown San Diego get away. The hotel is clean, neat, and very comfortable. I was visiting San Diego with my two daughters and we had a great room, comfortable beds, and great room service. The hotel is also in a great location which is walking distance to the Gas Lamp area and all the shops and restaurants. We had a great stay and I will go back to this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Think twice!”
Reviews.Author: AssociatedPress
Reviews.Content: Two things to note regarding my stay: 1. Check your baths towels before you start using them when you get out of the shower, two of the four towels had long strands of brown hair folded into them - disgusting is right! 2. Beware of having your vehicle valet'd at the hotel ... my vehicle returned with significant front end damage. It might be worthwhile parking on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Good views and location in downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Frequent travelers
Reviews.Content: Westin took over this property about a year ago - building still needs a bit more upgrading but nothing serious and rooms are large, well appointed with great views. (ask for Bay View). We like the downtown location - short walk to bayfront park and restaurants as well as two blocks to trolley and transportation hub - just park the car. Have stayed in San Diego many times, including apartment rental - this was a short visit and we'd pick this Westin again (not the gaslamp one). Try the food in Little Italy and the Gaslamp - both areas are walking distance with lively atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Lacks Personality”
Reviews.Author: HAPPYBIRDJZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Downtown Westin during the US Open. I found this to be a very adequate hotel. The room was clean, the bed comfy, nice linens. Service Ok. I really can't say there was anything wrong with the experience. The desk clerk was alittle robotic. What I didn't like was that I found it to be a really cold experience. The hotel and staff seemed to all lack personality. I could have been at any Westin in any city, because they all look the same! Boring. I was at a Seattle Westin that was almost identical. The colors in the room were sort of a pale grey/beige. I remember years ago that staying at a Westin meant a spectacular hotel with first class service. I think that the "Starwood" hotel conglomerate have turned them all into cookie cutter chains with nothing great to rave about. Overall, nothing to write home about. I did check out the Westin in the Gaslamp area not to far away and it looked to be quite the opposite. If I ever go back to S.D, I would try that one instead.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it”
Reviews.Author: pycky
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good. It is near Horton Plaza, Convention Center, Harbor. Bathroom is roomy, beds are very comfortable, carpet was soft and clean. Our room was across the elevator and near the ice machine but did not hear any noise during our 4 days stay. The only problem is that there are two Westin Hotels in San Diego downtown close to each other. This is on Broadway. It is easy to find at night, when you look up there is a green neon ligh stripe which outlines the top of the building. If you do not want to pay $27 parking/night, after 6 pm there are plenty of parking next to parking meters On Columbia Street for example (that is where you drop off your car if you wish to use to hotel's parking) I found several place to park my car. Usually 6 pm - 8 am you can park your car there (but wach for street cleaning which may start at 6 am on certain days). The area around the hotel is nice, clean, and safe, pleasant to walk around even at night.

Reviews.Title: “Keep Your Pants On...this place is boring and uninspired”
Reviews.Author: Shotgun_Joe
Reviews.Content: This joint is a ho-hum hotel that is more suited for business travelers than for couples on vacation. The service is what you'd expect from Westin, but nothing about this hotel really stood out. We were here for a formal dinner in the large conference room and I swear my shoe leather was softer then the beef. The front desk personnel were fine, the valet was fine, the room was fine. This hotel was so fine that I'm getting bored writing this review, so I'll sign off. (This place is a far cry from the Chicago Westin.)

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service!”
Reviews.Author: myteem
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin for a conference and absolutely LOVED the room. The room was very clean, the beds were soooo comfortable, the shower with its double head was great, the TV was a plasma screen, and wireless worked very well. The only problems I had was the remote control battery dying and the internet not working after the 3rd day, but the staff people I spoke with to correct these problems were more than courteous and very prompt and professional. I would stay here again, even for vacation, just for the beds, shower, and TV!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: mahalofromCA
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my hubby, and 3 kids (7, 5, 1) and had a great time. I thought the room (2 doubles) was spacious and the beds were sooo cozy. We could walk to the USS Midway, and many restaurants..took a pedal cab to sea port village for $10. The rail station is only a block away. We enjoyed the pool and the hotel was very clean. Of course, the parking was outrageous and we didn't eat at the hotel. There are a few family-type restaurants very close. Overall, this hotel was a great deal at $165 a night -booked throught travelocity.

Reviews.Title: “Better hotels in San Diego for the price”
Reviews.Author: Donnel
Reviews.Content: We quickly checked into the hotel at noon and immediately went up to our room after valeting our car. We were quite disappointed in the room. It was small. not very nicely decorated, the TV didn't work, the bathroom was dark and dingy with all four lights on, and there were no bathroom toiletries for a shower. Fortunately we had our own. In the morning, we ate at the restaurant. Expensive! We got a newspaper the first morning, but none the second. On check-out morning, there was a bill under the door and I wanted to question a couple of items that had been charged i.e. parking for $81 for a two days stay and I wastold that I would have to come down to the front desk to discuss it. So I did, but no resolution. We had a wonderful stay in San Diego, but I would never stay at the San Diego Westin again nor would I recommend it to my friends unless they had a business meeting there. It would be a good spot for a business meeting at company expense!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very high priced”
Reviews.Author: ESA178
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located a couple of blocks from Amtrak. They have a shuttle bus from the airport. Upon check in, the room was not made up. Which was initially ok, because they sent us from the 10th floor to the 22nd. But the new room was smaller. Sometimes my 7 year old daughter walked into the bathroom after opening the room door, because of the design of the room. View was nice from 2221, with some bay and Coronado. Beware, they are starting to dig foundations in front, so I am sure in a year there will be no view, what with a new building. The air conditioning is noisy, and the sink makes a Glug Glug sound for a few minutes after running water (air in the pipes). We were smart and didn't rent a car until the day we wanted to visit the coast up to Oceanside and back inland to San Diego. $28.00 per day parking at the hotel! You can take the #7 bus to the Zoo from 1st and Broadway. $2.25 each way. Free for 5 and under. We arrived around 2pm. walked over to the Gaslamp district, about 8 blocks, then down to Seaport Village, back through Horton plaza. Had dinner at Blue Point on 5th....very $$. $135.00 for 2 adults and 1 child. The second day we took the bus to the zoo and had dinner at Henry's pub on 5th. $50. Including a beer(Newcastle). Unlike Blue Point, Henry's has a kids menu. We then rented a car from Avis on Kettener and Cedar around 8am for $50 incl taxes and booster seat. We drove up the coast and then back for a 6pm departure from the airport. I would stay at the hotel again, but only if I use my miles like I did this time. Otherwise $250 per night inclusive is a little high for 2 adults and a child.

Reviews.Title: “If it's Tuesday, this must be a Westin”
Reviews.Author: timelvis
Reviews.Content: One thing you have to say about a Westin is that they are consistently the same. No matter what city...or even country... you are in, you step into a Westin room and you have to look out the window to remind yourself where you are. This is not necessarily a bad thing. When you are traveling on business (which this visit to the Westin San Diego was), it is nice to have some place familiar to hang your hat. You have your Heavenly Bed with upteen pillows and your Heavenly Bath with a double shower head (too bad the water pressure wasn't double, too). What was different about this Westin was the 32-inch flat screen LCD television with several HD channels that left me craving digital when I returned home. What wasn't different was the sporatic wireless Internet connection. And what wasn't different was the overpriced onsite restaurant with the same menu as room service. Trust me, this gets tedious if you are staying in a hotel more than two nights and you can't get out to find a decent restaurant. There is a Ralph's grocery store a few blocks away if you want to cut the cost and buy your own snacks. Be forewarned there are no refridgerators in the room (although you can improvise with the in room snack center). The Westin San Diego is in a great downtown location. They provide a free airport shuttle (ten minutes away) and you are a few blocks from the waterfront, Gas Town and Little Italy. And it is in San Diego after all, one of the most beautiful American cities. There is a decent (but small) workout room and equally small and odd shaped outdoor pool that is adjacent to the conference rooms (so don't expect privacy if you are sunbathing). All in all the Westin San Diego is a decent place to stay if you are on business and someone else is footing the bill. If you are on vacation, I'd opt for something different.

Reviews.Title: “Not What You Would Expect from Westin”
Reviews.Author: tzinnca
Reviews.Content: This hotel is below expectations for a Westin. My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights during a business trip. The location is good for walking to San Diego's business district, and plenty of restaurants and shopping are nearby. I would recommend this hotel to business travelers, but not for vacationers. Below Average: Valet Service is poor for the heafty $27.00/night. The bathroom was small and the drains were clogged. Elevators were very slow. The decor was odd - very modern furniture in a very outdated room. Hallways are narrow and confustng to navigate. Good Points: Location. Friendly Service. Downtown View.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the location, loved that Heavenly bed!”
Reviews.Author: TexasAMC3
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at this Westin chosen for us by the powers that be for the meeting my husband attended. Check-in was beyond slow as there was just one person working the front desk when we, along with a throng of others, arrived early on a Sunday afternoon. We were given a corner room on the 18th floor which came with a window facing downtown, and a window facing the Coronado Bridge--not bad. The room was a little tight but there was more than enough storage space for everything. The room looked newly updated, nice calming color scheme, flat screen tv, very cozy and comfortable. The bathroom was an odd set-up--the sink area was to the left of the room, out in the open, while the tub and toilet were in a closet sized room of their own with a none too handy pocket door. We really did not like this at all. There was room for very little movement in this room, no place to hang towels except for the shower rod and one small hook. The tub and toilet were so close together that towels hanging from said rod were in the way. I don't know how the cleaning folks work in that tight space but they seemed to manage quite well given the cleanliness of it all. We had dinner in the restaurant one night it poured rain and friends we were with didn't want to go out. Others had the same idea and the restaurant was understaffed, clearly not expecting the crowd they served that night, but given the circumstancs I think they rallied well and the food was good. We've been to San Diego before and while we prefer to stay closer to the water (Sea Port Village, Coronado) we liked the location as we could walk almost everywhere....in fact, we did. However, I would stay here again only if we had to for another meeting. The hotel offers complimentary shuttle service to / from the airport and the staff we encountered at this hotel were professional, helpful and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Near Perfection”
Reviews.Author: MDFreqTvlr
Reviews.Content: I booked before it opened with a little trepidation, but the rate was too good to pass up. Any concerns were immediately put at ease when I walked into the lobby. It is a beautiful inner city hotel with a highly attentive staff. Location is closer to the business district, but walkable to the harbor and a variety of good restaurants. However, the hotel restaurant was outstanding. Great food and even better service! The only disappointment was that the room was a little on the small side, but very comfortable and an amazing view.

HotelInfo.Name: Westin San Diego
HotelInfo.Address: 400 West Broadway, San Diego, CA 92109
